description:
I got an Al pastor burrito from here the other day. The burrito was a wonderful size, and the taste was fresh and executed perfectly. I got my food to go, so naturally they gave me chips and those were super tasty and had a great crunch to them. The salsa bar was cute and well maintained. I am definitely coming back because it has to be my favorite burrito spot off of Haight street. 

All the staff was very friendly and never missed a beat!!
author: Dominique A.

description:
Pro-tip: douse your burritos in salsa verde!

I ordered an Al pastor burrito and a Mexican cola to wash it down. The burrito unfortunately was just alright, but salsa Verde - which was one of the free condiments - was extra-ordinary. 

I am not sure if this will be a joint I'll be returning to regularly, but I'll surely miss that salsa verde!
author: Ji-Sub J.

description:
I enjoy the Street Taco on 9th street. As they have the same name I ordered from this place as it is available on Postmates. 

 I ordered the "street burrito" for delivery. The street burrito is classified as no rice and beans, but a double portion of meat.

As you are getting extra meat the burrito costs $13.00 before tax.

I received the smallest burrito I have ever received and paying 13.00 for a burrito the size of a 99 cent frozen burrito was not ideal.

As you can see in the picture this was laughable.
author: Alex B.

description:
Coming from LA I remain on the quest for amazing Mexican food in SF. Yes yes there're good places but I just haven't gotten to them yet. Street Taco is pretty decent and there's a very generous assortment of salsas to fill up on.

So the burritos are the main attraction here. Al pastor is usually always my go to. So yeah, grab a burrito, fill up on salsas, and eat up to your heart's content. The salsas are ranging from mild to hot but who settles for mild?

Prices are standard for SF and the portions are quite generous. For what it is, this is a good place for your Mexican food cravings.
author: Derek T.

description:
I am obsessed with their nachos! I'm almost here once a week. If it's not their nachos, I get their tacos, duh!

My usual order is nachos with chicken. It's a pretty big portion for one person and sadly I can never finish the whole thing! 

Their chips are good, the salsas are good, and everything is fresh! 

Gets really busy on the weekend, but definitely worth it!
author: Fallon P.

description:
Pretty solid stuff. The in-house made tortillas have great texture and the al pastor is pretty legit. I didn't try it but the costilla (beef ribs) were an extra $4 and that amount of premium is quite intriguing and will necessitate another visit, particularly because I heard someone else try to get it and it was sold out.

I've also had the fish burrito and it is a good one.
author: Misha T.

description:
Was looking around Haight Ashbury for a place to each lunch and walked by this place. Simple menu where you pick what you want and then what type of meat. They have a large list of meat types.  

Picked the super burrito with no sour cream and al pastor.  Was probably one of the most flavorful and tasty burritos I've had in a long time and I just moved from San Diego and was missing good Mexican food. They make their own tortillas and the inside of the burrito had the perfect consistency and texture. The ratio of meat, beans, rice, guacamole was perfect. They have 3 salsas too which were really good complements. The green sauce had a nice lime flavor with a kick.  Will try the other meats next time. The beef rib looked really good.
author: Mark W.

description:
Stumbled in to this place with my cousin today.  

I've had authentic Mexican food at my grandma in laws and in Mexico,  and HERE!!! 

The meat was perfectly seasoned,  the black beans were perfect,  so was the guacamole!! The atmosphere is great,  busy tourists and locals all enjoying a meal.  

Friendly,  happy,  helpful staff who don't seem bothered that the line is out the door.  Everyone is chill,  from the staff to the customers.  

I'll be back.
author: Lynnette F.

description: They have awesome customer service , and their food is great ! I got the regular burrito with nopales and for me it was just a bit overwhelming with "garlic" but other than that it was awesome. Their meat smells super fresh and perfectly seasoned. As a Mexican who was actually raised with Mexican food in his household I approve of this places and recommend it. They need better salsas at the salsa bar.
author: Filiberto E.

description:
This is the perfect place to bring parents and family to eat at to get a taste of SF mexican food  without having to go to a dive-y taqueria. 

P.S. You can also order at Hobson's Choice next door. Drinks n' tacos.
author: Erica C.

description:
WOW, we did not expect to have delicious tacos when in SF Haight district! Cute little hole in the wall spot. We walked in and notice that there was not a seat available in the house. So we opted to stand up by the water fountain. 
We ordered a fish and carne taco and were so stunned by how delicious the tacos were! I still think about the tacos till today! This is a legit Mexican spot in the city and will recommend this place to anyone that plans to visit! This is located about 4 to 5 blocks down from the Whole Foods Market.
author: Angie G.

description:
While visiting San Francisco we tried to hit as many areas as possible and found ourselves in the Haight-Ashbury area around lunchtime One day.

We found the food choices rather limited in the area but made a decision based on a referral from a local retailer and it was a good one.

The place is small so our party of 6 had to sit at 2 different tables, but that was fine.

You can watch the meat being grilled right before your eyes which is very appetizing.
 the salsa bar offered some good choices.
All of the meals are accompanied by a small bowl of chips for the asking.

You order at the counter and seat yourself but the line moved quickly and I imagine if we were there a little later the line would have been less.

The guys had burritos which were huge. The nachos were yummy and the carnitas tacos were delicious.
Stop in when you are in the area.
author: Sherri G.

description:
LIttle tiny delicious taco shop. The line was out the door but moved really fast. They know how to move the crowd. A few interesting meat options, but just your basic tacos and burritos for the most part, but really well done.  Their veggie ones have actual grilled vegetables, as opposed to being just beans and cheese, so that was nice.

The place was filled with locals getting to-go and a few of us who were just roaming around Haight. If I lived nearby, this would be my local taqueria for sure! Good food, good prices, salsa bar.  Bueno!
author: Sharon V.

description:
This is like a pretend gourmet place even though it's called street taco.  You get your tacos in a square white plate, por ehemplo.  That's not streets of d.f. (cdmx?).  Also, the tacos are like 60 or 70 pesos each here.  Overall, I'd say it was decent.  Especially with the choice of salsas, which was decent.  Also other stuff was decent.

The place has a kind of prison feel, which is not really their fault but due to all the homeless dudes around Haight who cause businesses to make sure everything can be hosed down easily and have strict bathroom policies and stuff.  I guess that sounds racist against homeless people but  I think it's true, probably.  Sad!
author: Asper K.

description:
If you want some fast Mexican food, this is the place to be.    

We ordered chips and salsa.  We did not expect the serving to be so large.  There were definitely a lot of chips and a huge bowl of salsa.   The salsa had a hint of spiciness.  It was great! 

My husband was looking forward to some yummy tacos.  While looking at the menu, he noticed that they only serve 2 tacos per order.  We were kind of surprised by that, because two tacos just didn't sound like it would be enough.  We were wondering how big they were, and should he place two orders of tacos instead of just one for himself?  Well, luckily we ordered only one plate of tacos.  The tacos were generously filled with meat that will definitely fill you up.

I had the Street Bowl.  I thought it was delicious.  It had the right amount of toppings to make the whole bowl balanced.  

The only con about this place is limited seating.  Luckily, people can be in and out of the door, because the food was served pretty quickly, and there was always someone cleaning up the tables as soon as it opens.
author: Samantha L.

description:
This is very close to a Mexican Street Taco.  The line was out the door after we showed up.  After having the tacos, I understood why.  

They are prepared very authentic to the way i've had them in Mexico City.  There is festive music playing overhead and it makes you feel like you are in the streets of Mexico City.  The flavors are fresh and you are definitely transported to another place.  A place where deliciousness exists!  Once again, I had a hard time choosing because I kept seeing everyone's order come through and...I want that!  No, I want that...wait, can we get one of these and 2 of those!?!?!?  

If you are into authentic tacos...not corn shells loaded with sour cream...but authentic tacos loaded with meat and fresh cilantro, tomato, onion...come here!  You'll thank me later.  You're welcome. :)
author: Tasjuaii M.

description:
Can't 5 star it since I've lived in Texas, but if I hadn't gone, I probably would.

Best tacos I've had in Cali. You can definitely tell the tortillas are GOOD homemade tortillas. You can smell the corn tortilla scent hours after you wash your hands. 

They have cactus and seafood, and all the other regular options. Just missing the legua, chicharron, etc.

I guess their salsa could be better but it's still great.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Yup! This is Mexico City in San Francisco. This is a must. I still can't believe how good it was. The tacos were amazing! No really, they were that good. 

Have you ever wanted something really good to eat but you couldn't describe what it was? Like, you know the flavors you're looking for and simply can't explain it? Well, these tacos do the explaining for you. They attack your taste buds and set up a home and don't pay rent because they don't have to. They're soooo good. There's so much meat. There's so many toppings. They are it. 

Okay, here's the sad part. Seating is limited, but people are super kind and will treat the seating situation like community seating. I love that. It's also a bit pricy for tacos, but meh, the goodness of the food explains why. 

Anyway, go here and be happy. It's seriously a good place to put on SF's must eats.
author: Emiel B.

description:
Meh. It was an okay burrito but way over-priced in my opinion.  I ordered guac and there was barely any added. Especially with an extra charge for guac, I was expecting a little more generosity! Also, the chips seemed a bit old which sort of defeats the purpose because I can just buy a bag of tortilla chips from the grocery store.

I guess if you need a burrito and you're not in the Mission, you could come here. I also had a bad case of food poisoning after and I'm not positive if it was this meal or the one after but either way it left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Jess Y.

description:
We were first drawn in by the name and, secondly, by the look of the place. The street view of Street Taco is attractive, enticing even. It wears the promise of a really satisfying taco. 

The interior is post-industrial faux-urban warehouse meets real taqueria (a self-consciously slightly grungified version of a Chipotle, if you will).  

The menu is brief, which I always appreciate, and straightforward.  The cashier was friendly and warm. The cooks in the cramped and too-close open kitchen were loud and somewhat surly, as if they were not aware they could be seen and heard by customers. 

We ordered 4 tacos -- 3 carnitas and one al pastor -- along with a Street "Caesar" Salad (quotations are mine). 

Now I have lived in San Francisco more than 35 years. I love taquerias.  I love tacos.  I love San Francisco tacos. I have eaten hundreds -- probably thousands -- of tacos at taquerias in and around San Francisco as well as up and down the West Coast and throughout Mexico, New Mexico and Texas. 

I can without hesitation say that the tacos we had at at Street Taco were the worst I have ever had. The nice-looking homemade style corn tortillas were soggy, the texture of very wet cardboard.  The grayish meat had a similar texture. (The word "mushy" comes to mind.)  Topped with a paltry dollop of not super fresh Pico de Gallo, the flavors melded to create a taste that was vaguely reminiscent of... well, of nothing.  To say the taste was bland would be inaccurate because "bland" indicates the presence of at least some flavor, some taste.  These tacos were bizarrely virtually tasteless.  I mean I had to put salt on the tacos (on carnitas no less!) to sense any flavor.   

Now the Street "Caesar" Salad-- well I'll admit the mistake was mine in ordering it.  Did I really expect a Caesar Salad? No. Did I expect something that at least attempted to mimic the basics of said salad?  Yes, I did.  And I was sorely disappointed.   But I'm tired of writing this review so suffice it to say it did not resemble the classic salad in any way and no part of it tasted really fresh. 

Did I mention the deeply malodorous street guy who came in, sat down at a recently vacated table and began to consume leftovers on said table?  Staff did nothing despite the fact that his presence -- more specifically it was the stench emanating from him, which caused eyes to water --caused everyone at each table around him to move or leave within  minutes of him sitting down. 

Oh.  And the chips were bad.
author: Timothy C.

description:
What a gem in Haight-Ashbury! We were running low on fuel from a day filled with hiking and walking throughout the city and Street Taco stood out as the perfect snack before our dinner in a few hours.

Their menu consists of tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos and bowls but the portions are generous and the ingredients are fresh. We ordered the tacos (2 for $7) as well as chip and guac. Everything was delicious and devoured within minutes.

Seating is limited but we got lucky. There's a busboy that clears the tables so you can go ahead and sit at a dirty one and they'll get it to it quickly.
author: Annie P.

description: Consistent and good every time.  Sometimes it gets a little crowded in there, but that just speaks to how YUM the food is, right?  Even when the line is long, the service is quick and friendly!
author: Courteney S.

description: The nachos are super. I've had the asada and the pollo. Delicious. Lots of flavor. I don't remember having any better nachos anywhere.
author: Gary M.

description: I usually praise this spot, and I'm a complete optimist most of the time, but my opinion of ST has definitely changed. There are too many great burrito spots to be chastised as a customer for speaking plain English! They got none of the order right, despite me explaining it clearly several times, didn't want to make it right, the manager or owner who is always here was extremely rude and blew me off, and despite me having my order ticket, which was right, and the food item, which was wrong, they told me that I was wrong, then looked at my ticket and concurred they had made a mistake! Wish I hadn't have tipped them. Adios, Street Taco. I work too hard for my money to put up with this poor service. There's lots of other choices that blow you out of the water anyway.
author: Carey C.

description:
I stopped here for a quick lunch on my way to an appointment. I got in line, ordered 2 tacos Al pastor, which was about 10$ and grabbed a spot at the bar waiting area. My order number was caked within about 5-7 minutes. This place is small and there are no 2-seater tables, so I felt weird grabbing a table for 4 in a busy restaurant, but I didn't want to eat standing up. I sat and began to eat quickly, as I was in a bit of a hurry. After a few minutes, 2 groups of 4 people walked in and immediately began starting me down while they waited for their numbers to be called. While my food was very good, I felt pressured to finish my lunch even faster then I was planning to do my meal was difficult to enjoy... 

Once I finished my plate, I hadn't even finished the bite in my mouth, this 20-something girl came up to me and asked if I was leaving soon. I was so embarrassed and felt so uncomfortable. I didn't even bother finishing my drink, or saying anything to get. I just smiled and left. That was very rude of her, not the restaurant. 

My point in telling this story is that maybe if your dining alone, I would avoid this busy spot, stand at the bar and eat, or maybe take your food to go. This could also serve as feedback for the restaurant - please add a few 2-seat tables in your restaurant!
author: Taylor D.

description:
These 4 stars don't lie! This place is waaaay better than El Rancho Grande down the street!

Their menu is oh so simple and oh so filling and mouth watering. Their salsas are also excelente! This is a made to order, walk up and pay and wait type of place. It is very tiny inside! It's almost as if you have to dive for a seat as soon as another patron leaves because the seats here get taken quickly. Get ready to dive for it and move quickly when someone or a group leaves; no joke!

I love their nachos! They have burritos, nachos, tacos, quesadillas, and bowls. You may add any type of meat that you want to the above. I recommend their camarones (shrimp) if you are not allergic. The burritos come with chips if you get that so don't order chips and salsa unless you want extra. 

The food here is excellent and I recommend it for Mexican food that is inexpensive, but also flavorful in the city. Thumbs up guys, keep it up!
author: Jam P.

description: Great option in the Haight area to get your Mexican fix. The place is pretty packed and there's likely a line but it does move quickly. As soon as I saw the Al Pastor rotating, I knew that's what I wanted to order. The nachos looked great.. the Al Pastor burrito was good. Do remember to pick up the salsa containers near the register and fill up on all the delicious salsas. Restrooms are available at the back. There's seating but it's packed so you might find it easier to do takeout.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I typically spend my lunch break at El Rancho Grande across the street, but my best friend is in town and she coaxed me into changing it up! While standing outside of Street Taco, a man caught us squinting through the window at the menu and told us that Street Taco was "the best Mexican in the Haight." 

How could anyone say no to that?! 

The vibe inside is wonderful! Festive Mexican music
plays over the loudspeaker, and the service is quick as a whip. In the middle of the lunch rush, we still had ample room to sit, and the tables were nice and clean. 

I didn't see what I wanted on the menu, but the cashier rang it up for me anyway (rice, bean, and guac burrito for about 6.50). My partner ordered the super burrito with chicken, and my best friend ordered the nachos (holy crap they looked stellar). The salsa bar is THE ABSOLUTE BEST i've ever experienced. No grilled onions or limes, but the three salsas they have are incredible. Full disclosure: the salsa verde almost made me cry. it was even better than I thought possible. Be careful though, the salsas weren't labeled when I went, so if you don't like spice...go with a seasoned vet. The chunkier salsa to the left of the verde was pretty high on the spicy side. The chips are thick corn, very lightly salted-my ideal tortilla chip. Not a single oil-laden chip in sight. 

For the record, I firmly believe that El Rancho Grande still has better, more authentic burrito tortillas... but I'll definitely be splitting lunch breaks between the two from now on.
author: Kendall G.

description: Street Taco is a bit on the pricer side but the Haight is super touristy so what can you expect? I'm sure the rent is crazy high for everyone. Anyway back to the food, the tacos and burritos are delicious. I normally get carne asada or carnitas tacos and then for burrito I get shrimp burrito. The place has about 10 tables so it can get crowded unless you have someone get a seat while you wait in line to order.
author: Ted Y.

description: Nestled in an eclectic neighborhood, where the people watching is perfect. The pork super burrito was awesome, guacamole is on a chunky side which was perfect and very tasty. I wasn't crazy about my shrimp taco.
author: Jenna G.

description: Came because I saw it on a food blog and happened to spot it when I was walking through the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood. I ordered a steak street bowl, It was very tasty and filling for the price and i really liked the crispy bowl. They top it off well with cheese, pico, lettuce, guac, beans, rice. They have a little bar of various salsas you can take as well and this picked cabbage that was an amazing addition to the bowl! Staff was really friendly. It's located in a pretty cool neighborhood so worth stopping by if you're walking through it.
author: Leah S.

description: Stopped in after our sensory overload exploration of Haight-Ashbury-Ashbury. Menu is very simple. Options available for those who don't eat meat. Complimentary chips are provided, and they even have a small salsa station. Our burritos were yummy, but they messed up our order. Luckily, I'm not deathly allergic to sour cream or I'd be dead on the ground. They also got the sauces wrong. We chose not to complain because we were in a hurry to catch a flight.
author: Elle K.

description:
Oh my goodness! This place was delicious!!!! We came to Street Taco on a Wednesday night around 530pm. Dinner time so yes it was busy. Being that there were only about 5 tables in this small location, we kept our eyes peeled for people who looked like they were leaving, and luckily we found a place. This is more of a quick go to place, so don't make plans for a sit down dinner because it's only if you get lucky. 

We ordered chicken nachos, and an Al Pastor quesadilla with a Coke. Nachos were on point! Super delicious, especially if you get the variety of salsas from the bar area on the side and change up each dip. Quesadilla hit the spot, but wasn't the best Al Pastor I have had. I had high expectations since it looked delicious cooking. 

Will definitely come back for nachos!
author: Erica C.

description: Delicious tacos. Very quick service. Pretty Clean. Would definitely go back to try more
author: Sonia D.

description:
TLDR - Quick, easy Mexican food, relatively cheap and filling, pretty tasty

Somewhat small Mexican joint in the Haight. Pretty busy on a Sunday night, but it's still reasonably quick. There isn't a ton of seating (maybe 6 tables) but most people seem to get their food to go.

Standard Mexican menu - tacos, burritos, quesadillas, tostada bowls - and salads for something healthier. Lots of meat options and veggie too. They're pretty generous with the portion sizes for meat, especially given the price, which was much appreciated.

* STREET BOWL ($9.50) - 4/5
[flour tostada bowl w/ meat, beans, cheese, guac, lettuce & salsa]
Very filling bowl. Fresh ingredients. Lots of meat and beans. I got mine with carne asada, which was well seasoned and tender. The tostada bowl was crunchy and a little flaky, but I found it to be a little greasy. I've had ones that were perfectly fried without that greasy feeling.

They have a salsa/condiment bar for you to help yourself. None of the salsas were particularly spicy but I did like the smokiness of the fire-roasted tomato salsa. The pickled veggies were good too, especially the jalapeños if you need some heat with your order.
author: Jessie L.

description: Fresh Mexican but nothing that makes it stand out from other taqueria style places. If you are in the neighborhood and looking for a taco or burrito stop in for fresh ingredients and flavor.
author: Roma N.

description: Damn, this place gets busy!  Stopped in for a quick dinner.  Luckily the line does move pretty quick.  I ended up getting the nachos, they were huge!  Very generous servings of toppings, all of which were great too.  For the price, it was definitely worth it.  Overall, it hit the spot. They've got a decent amount of seating too, but it does seem to fill up quick during peak hours.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Food was alright for a fast food Mexican joint! I ordered the fish bowl, I wish it would
Have came with rice! The lady working the register said no free refills or discounts with our drinks! And what didn't look too clean was the jugs they had the cantaloupe juice in weren't covered so looks like arm pit crust could easily fall in especially since it's right behind the register! We asked the lady for a little more complimentary tortilla chips and she gave us the coldest stare ever lol! Would definitely come back if needed a quick bite to eat!
author: Holly S.

description: The food looks good until you bite into it, was so greasy. Had a al pastor super burrito without the sour cream and with black beans. Threw up a few hours later, didnt even drink that day.
author: Christina T.

description: I got then tacos with beef and chorizo and a watermelon Agua Fresca. The meat was amazing and really well spiced. I really think that you should go for that. Also when I got there the line was nonexistent but 10 min later it was packed so I suggest getting there before 12:45.
author: Oona O.

description: Wow! So delicious! A single order of tacos comes with two tacos and a side of chips. These tacos have so much meat on them, they do not disappoint!! And the nachos - talk about a perfect combo!! Everything is so fresh and made so quickly, I'm definitely coming back!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
The line here was ridiculously long! Most seemed to to-go their order so it freed up the few available tables and chairs within the restaurant. 

Their burrito was da bomb. It was comparable to Chipotle's. It was a pretty sizable thing full of flavor and meat -- made up of chorizo and beef. Oh. If you make it extra spicy, there is an extra charge of $1. There was also the super burrito, but that thing seemed like an overload of something already good. 

The cactus and fish tacos were eh. They lacked flavor so I wasn't really into it. The bf and I never had cactus before, and so I urged him to choose cactus as the meat. It was slimy and tasted like any other veggie.

The fish on the second taco was huge. Again, the fish wasn't marinated in anything special so it lacked flavor and life. Good? Yes, but it was super ordinary. 

Street Taco was pretty popping with the locals. If you're from GA then you'd know that Street Taco sat in the heart of what Georgians call Little Five Points -- a place with people and places of their own character and flair.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Love, Love, Love this place and all the employees. Very friendly bunch and it's a bustling business indeed.
I mostly go when I get the coupon in the mail box for 2 tacos for $2.00 off. They are The Best Deal in town and prepared fresh. Tons of meat in each and you usually need a fork when it's all over and oh yeh, a few extra napkins.  The salsas on the side bar are all worth a dip as well.

I have not tried anything else, as I can't get past the Tacos.

A couple issues with this gem is the music (Spanish) is Way Too Loud and Not Necessary !  Sometimes the noise is almost unbearable. This even when the place is slow or packed, too much music !!!!

The clearing of tables is very, very slow and one often has to eat at a dirty table, covered in old used plates.  My suggestion, put some dish tray somewhere, where folks can dump their own plates. Too often I see "many staff" and "managers" just hanging back, watching the crowd when clearly "someone" can see the tables need to be bussed.
author: Marla B.

description: Small little restaurant and not much seating, but the food was good. Got the nachos al pastor and the chips were good. But I really enjoyed the super burrito with carne asada. The carne asada is really good.
author: Elda Q.

description:
My friends and I were headed to a comedy show at Milk Bar and someone suggested Street Taco as the place to satisfy Mexican food cravings. It's a few blocks away from Milk Bar, with a conservative amount of seating inside. The room configuration is a little strange too. Standing in line and waiting for food can feel a bit cramped if you have a larger group, so grab seats right away if you plan to stay. Seems like it fills up very quickly. Fortunately, we got our food to-go and ate at Milk Bar.

Altogether, our group ordered a variety of different things, though I settled for a carne asada street bowl. The menu is very straightforward, between the meat options and the way your tortilla wraps (or doesn't wrap) around the meat. The street bowl is served in a flour tostada bowl and it's surprisingly filling! I like the quality of the tostada bowl. Coming here is very cost-efficient as well for Mexican food.

Though the food was quite tasty, I wouldn't go out of my way to come to the Haight and eat here, but if I was in the neighborhood and craving Mexican, Street Taco is the obvious choice. There are so many great eateries along Haight St, and I'm glad that this is one of many tasty options to choose from!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Seriously so good and so fresh. Tacos were what I was hoping for. We got chips and salsa as well and it was awesome. Place is small, so seating is kind of limited but oh well! Quality was great and I'd love to go back!
author: Rachel K.

description:
Do you like Nachos?  I mean do you really like Nachos?  These are some of the best you'll ever have!  My gal and I typically go for the veggie, though sometimes I'll add Al Pastor on the side.  Make sure you get extra chips.  The nachos are so loaded with goodness you'll need extra scoops!  Make sure to get samples of everything from the salsa bar.  We really enjoy the salsa verde and pickled veggies.  There is a small amount of seating but we prefer to take our food next door to Hobson's Choice for Rum Punches and a much out session.
The best taqueria in the Haight going, it's worth the line!
Thanks Street Taco.....We'll be back!
author: Jim P.

description: Easy read menu and on point taste and quality. Please take a moment to appreciate the tortillas. I shared a chicken super burrito and carne asada tacos - they were delicious and you feel great after eating. No regrets.
author: Anisa A.

description:
Very good value and tasty BIG burritos. I am stuffed! I expected to pay way more in this neighbourhood. Friendly staff and good salsas. Love it all. Oh, you get free chips too, which is nice.
Oh, one thing. Turn off the TV. No one is watching it!
author: Phil R.

description:
SO GOOD. Got the carne asada burrito and it was the size of my arm, I kid you not. I was impressed with how quick the service was, and appreciated the little sampler showing the beans and salsas. Also love the salsa bar. 

One star off because after using the bathroom I wanted a shower, but not every place is perfect. 

Excellent value for money.
author: Rachel W.

description: So far the best meat I have ever eaten in SF. The place is pretty clean other than the other taco places.
author: Ilker D.

description:
Mexican gem in haight!

Salsa - must have. Fresh, spicy and delicious. And for $3.50 it was a large amount. We ended up taking the rest home. It's too good to waste
Street bowl - grilled shrimp was cooked perfectly. The bowl was the perfect amount of food. Tortilla shell was perfectly crispy

Place is small. Only a handful of tables but we were still able to get the stroller to fit. Food came out really fast. Line can be a little long at times. Luckily we got there just before a big rush came in
author: Lisa D.

description:
Tacos never seem to disappoint for any meal throughout the day.    

Carne Asada- good flavor, packed with meat
Pescado- huge piece of perfectly cooked fish, needs the squirt of lime, add salsa for some heat
Chips & Guac- you can't go wrong with chips & guac BUT THIS WAS AMAZING

Haight use to be the spot in my high school days and it's been some time now since I ventured out here.  With food like this, I might have to pay another visit.
author: Linda N.

description:
$8 USD for 2 soft tacos of any meat, of course we went for the better value meat and had the shrimp and steak tacos. The shrimp was really good, big pieces and not mini frozen ones, had 5 pieces of shrimp. The steak taco was loaded with meat too. In fact, there was so much meat it made it hard to actually eat the taco without everything falling out. Real bang for your buck. My only complaint was the taco ingredients inside were wet which made the taco skin turn soggy real quick.
Taco bowl with pork ($11 USD)
The taco bowl was super crunchy like nachos and worked out perfectly cause you could just break the bowl and scoop all the inside ingredients. Comes with black beans or rice, and lettuce tomatoes and guacamole. The pork was really tasty! Meat was well flavored and juicy.

Loved it! So glad i stopped by to grab a bite.
author: Debbie P.

description: Asada nachos was great and experience was good only complaint was the salsas not great. neither of us cared for any of the salsas. Asada was bomb though
author: Jerret M.

description:
Yum! We were on a bus tour and pass this place. Yelp gave it good reviews so we hopped off. It's definitely delicious. So the cashier does speak English but didn't really understand when I was asking for recommendations. My boyfriends mom and I ended up ordering tacos and he ordered the burrito. We also ordered nachos to split. So the Alambres taco was delicious. We both loved it. I also ordered the shrimp taco (there is a $1 up charge). It was honestly unimpressive, not to say it wasn't good, but I wish I would have gotten 2 of the other taco. The burrito: it was huge. He loved the burrito but said it was definitely too much for him. I tasted it and it was on point. 
I would definitely come back here, but I do think the prices were slightly high. Even for San. Francisco. I think 2 small tacos without sides were $8.
author: Brittany N.

description: After a long day exploring the city I quickly searched on yelp quick eats in the Haight area. So happy I chose this place. It was quick, cheap and delicious and that's a combo that's not easy to find! I ordered the street bowl. The taco shell bowl was pretty standard. The meat (carne asada) was really good and was plentiful, I found this surprising because usually businesses will fill bowls like this with the cheaper ingredients (lettuce etc) but not this restaurant! Free chips and salsa bar were great as well :)
author: Sarah T.

description:
Food is good. Some things like chips and salsa are over priced. But the noise level is so loud as to make it uncomfortable to eat here!!!
Take it to go!!!
author: La H.

description:
My taco bowl was huge! Pretty good and fairly priced. Perfectly crunchy tostada (the big chip to hold everything inside). Also served with complimentary chips and salsa. 

What I ordered:
"Street Bowl": flour tostada with meat, beans, cheese, guacamole, lettuce & salsa - $9.50
author: Miranda T.

description: This is my second time eating here now. OH MY GOODNESS. it is spectacular. Iv had their burritos and tacos. It's the perfect middle between a wet burrito and a regular. Full of flavor. And after you don't feel awful you feel great. Highly recommendable. Ask for there behind the counter pico.
author: Joey A.

description:
As a vegetarian, I'm a veggie burrito connoisseur. I've made it my duty to scour the land in search of the best vegetarian burrito. At the moment, it resides here.

These people know how to make a vegetarian burrito. The rice is cooked in vegetable stock, and the refried beans (if chosen instead of black) are cooked with vegetable oil, not lard.

I ordered a veggie super burrito without sour cream or cheese. It was absolutely divine. Definitely one of the best vegetarian burritos I've ever enjoyed. It was very long, slim, and wrapped tightly. This made it easy to devour without making a mess. The tortilla had a surprisingly good flavor and freshness to it, and every filling was of the perfect proportions (not 3/4 rice as some places tend to do). The grilled veggies were very yummy and clearly fresh.

One of the most satisfying meals I've had in a long time, and probably my favorite burrito right now (and I've had a lot of burritos). Bravo!
author: Ross M.

description:
Every neighborhood needs at least one solid Mexican food option right? Well, I think Street Taco might be the winner in the Upper Haight. It's hard not to compare burrito vs. burrito from all the other amazing taco shops we have in San Francisco, so I'll try my hardest not to do that in this review :) 

I ordered the carnitas super burrito which included: rice, beans, cheese, guac, carnitas, and pico. That's a lot inside right? It is a really big portion, so the value is there for sure. In fact, I couldn't even finish it. Sad times. The quality of the carnitas was great, and they even flat top seared the meat again before putting it in the burrito...solid move. The tortilla wasn't my favorite but, I'm pretty picky when it comes to the "tillas" so take it with a grain of salt. Anyway, it's a good burrito...especially if you're on that side of town. 

The place is always packed and you'll normally find a line starting at the door. However, I think thats due in part to the lack of design layout of the restaurant itself. The staff is friendly, be a little patient and enjoy your food :) 

Side note: The next time I'm there I am totally going for the super nachos and am going to get all medieval on those bad boys. Hasta!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Street Tacos has bomb tacos! Tacos come in orders of 2. For two meat tacos, it's $7. Since I'm giving up meat and poultry for the month of July, I got one fish and one shrimp taco for $9. I want sure what to expect but I needed a snack. The asada tacos looked extremely appealing and I'll probably come back to try it after July. 

After ordering and getting my number, my friends and I were able to get one of the few tables but they also have a place to stand and eat. The turnaround from ordering to eating was quick. 

The shrimp taco was my favorite. The shrimp was fresh and generous (5 on a corn tortilla). They marinated the shrimp before grilling it and adding a few squeezes of lime made it perfect!

The fish taco was also very generous with fish. This isn't your standard fish stick taco and did not have that frozen fishy taste or smell so I was pleased with it as well. 

My friends split one order of asada tacos (one mild and one spicy). The spicy one wasn't spicy enough for my friend but they both enjoyed their tacos nevertheless. 

You may have to ask for chips if they don't offer it but I was good without so I didn't mind. Would I go back? If in the neighborhood, absolutely!
author: Olivia C.

description:
SO HAPPY THIS PLACE IS NEAR ME! So important to have a dank burrito/taco place close to home. Not much is needed to be said when you've eaten a great burrito.

Second time I went, everything was in layers like they rolled it up the wrong way :( I was sad. All guac, then all beans, then all meat. Not ideal, but still tasty.

Third time I went, I got tacos. They were great and filling. Lots of carne!
author: Kelly G.

description: Great taco joint- loved their little salsa/topping bar. Two tacos were plenty for one person. Would absolutely recommend.
author: Alyssa B.

description:
3.5 Huevos

Unfortunately the Al Pastor rotisserie was not working....sad face.

Carnitas had good flavor but the texture wass a fail. Soggy and Limp ( Insert Cherylynn N double entendre here). In my lilly white opinion carnitas should be fried and have a crunchy texture....Gordo's does this really well.

The Chicken actually was pretty good.

I had a burrito and I thought it was just okay. My Wife's tacos were a much more appealing dish.

What I really noticed ( of course after the fact) were the Nachos.....everyone was getting them and they looked good and were a good bargain.

Chips are not homemade and generic.

Salsas are great but the Salsa bar  was never refilled...and pretty much empty.

Place is not the most clean.

Parking is a pure nightmare.
author: David G.

description:
Pretty solid Mexican food in the heart of the Haight. However, there is definitely better Mexican food in the city (hello, Mission District!) this is a great go-to when exploring Haight, or even better yet, grabbing a burrito and heading to Golden Gate Park.

Cheap, fast, and tasty. Now that's what I'm talking about.
author: Fiona F.

description: Excellent quick-serve mexican restaurant. The ability to see your food being cooked while you wait in line makes you want to try everything. The street bowl is a must get the crisp, delicate shell leads to the perfect bite. Excellent service, tasty food, and a must visit when on Haight
author: Nicholas C.

description:
Oh my! While staying in San Francisco, my friends and I hiked over a mile to this place.  Let me tell you, it was worth the thigh burn.  

I ordered nachos with black beans, no meat.  Avocado came with it, too! Woo! There were a lot of chips on that plate, and I ate every last one of them.  And it's not like those nachos you get where all the goods are only at the top and you need salsa to finish the rest of the chips. Oh no!  They are evenly distributed. My favorite is when you get to the bottom and the chips are a little soggy, covered in goodness.  Yes! I love it! I did the good food chair dance.Yes I did. 

The atmosphere is just right, too.  They had some good music playing. A little mix of everything: pop, oldies, salsa, salsa tropical, reggaeton, it was great! And you can't beat the price.  My meal was under $10.

This place is booming!  People everywhere.  You should go with 2 people, that way one of you can grab a table before they're all gone. You're guaranteed to do a little salsa in your seat while eating!
author: Demetria W.

description:
Really good food!

My bf and I actually stumbled upon this place while walking Haight St for thrift stores. 

The best stumble up in SF for sure, this is where you want to end up on an empty stomach. Any menu item will do the deed and make for a happy ending :) They have tacos, burritos, quesadillas, nachos, bowls(tostadas), sides of rice and beans, agua fresca! Portions are on point and you can't beat their authentic flavoring!

I had the super burrito with grilled shrimp, black beans, and no lettuce, sub cilantro! The flavor combination from all the ingredients were amahhhhh-zing! They have a great salsa bar with pickled onions too! I suggest you throw those on everything you eat, it adds an extra kick to any item. The tortillas are homemade which makes it even better. When I walked in and saw them making tortillas by hand I was SOLD! Anything authentic and fresh is a must for me. 

Seating is first come, first serve. Most people are courteous about the seating and eat quickly to help free up tables for incoming guests. I notice that most people are willing to share tables bc at the end of the day we all want to eat our DELICIOUS STREET TACO while it's fresh and hot! If you don't want to watch for a table or share a space they do have a standing counter as well.


When I take a trip to SF again, Street Taco will be one of my first few stops!
author: K C.

description: I come here regularly. The food is always on point. I typically get the nachos but the taco bowl and quesadilla is delicious too. This is my go to when I don't want to cook!
author: Jordan S.

description: Best Mexican in the Haight neighborhood including upper and lower. Don't mess around, get the Street Burrito Al Pastor.
author: Keith B.

description: This place is absolutely delicious. I think this is one of my favorite taco places in the SF now. They have a ton of meats to choose from. Price is pretty affordable as well. Staff is very friendly. Your food is made fast, good quality. There are a lot of tables to sit at but when they are busy then they are slammed so good luck finding a seat. They also have horchata! For some reason many Mexican restaurants don't carry it in SF, no clue why. They also have good vegetarian options as well.
author: Christina C.

description: Native SF reviewer here:  Better tasting than a lot if the Mission joints. It's the meat. Way tastier meat. Like MUCH juicier, meatier. Worth the price!
author: Nini M.

description: What a rip off. I just wanted one taco on my lunch break but instead they made me purchase two. I got a can of soda and asked for sour cream and my total was TWELVE DOLLARS. The taco was nasty. I definitely will not be back to try their $13 burrito. If they want to be authentic, they should keep their prices authentic as well.
author: Jennie R.

description:
We stopped in for lunch because my husband can't resist the smell of Mexican food. He enjoyed his steak burrito and chips & salsa. He also appreciated the speedy service. My take is a little different. 

I was surprised at how terrible the salsa was. I LOVE salsa.... and I couldn't eat this. The burrito was okay, but the meat was more like pot roast than steak. Also, even though it was mid-afternoon in a Thursday and there were only two other tables full, it was seriously loud in there.  Not my favorite dining experience, but I wouldn't run away screaming if my husband wanted to go back.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Come here for decent food but slow service, stale chips, old salsa and warm bottled water. Came in at 5pm on a Saturday. 
I called ahead to my order food so I could be in and out quick this took 3 tries till they answered and I didn't get vm. But the make you wait in the LONG ordering line to pickup an order. Went to the salsa bar and all but one of the bowls were empty. I asked them for some more. The bowl was caked with the old salsa. They didn't even wash out the old. Just added new salsa. So gross!!!! 
When I sat down to eat my burrito it tasted great. And they don't make them too big. But the chips were stale. And they had run out of cold bottled water so I got room temp.  It was a lackluster experience. I live nearby and might go back but not too often. This was disappointing.
author: Terese P.

description:
What a pleasant surprise! The portions were generous and the meat was perfectly cooked. They have a variety of options, meats and salsas. I prefer the meat tacos over the fish tacos.

Finding a table was a bit tricky, but luckily my friend eyed one out and snatched it quick. It's a real informal place with self-serve sauces and water.
author: Helen C.

description: First time to Street Taco. Food was really good. I ordered a cheese quesadilla that came with guacamole inside the quesadilla. The place is more of a take out kind of restaurant but you could eat on-site. We couldn't eat inside because they didn't accept my service dog....(!)
author: Laurence D.

description:
Nice little place.

Pro's:
good food
great fish tacos


Con's:
parking sucks
seating is very limited
author: C J.

description:
Call it arrogance, but having now spent three years as a resident of Dallas I've caught myself almost unknowingly fielding the opinion that there aren't any better tacos outside of the Texas state borders. Enter Street Taco, who slapped me right back down to earth some of the best authentic tacos I've had. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

I'll admit I was a bit skeptical when I walked through the doors of Street Taco. While the interior was nothing unlike what I commonly encounter back in Dallas, it all felt a bit strange strolling into an authentic Mexican taqueria in the midst of most groovy neighborhood in San Francisco. My hesitation was quickly washed away upon seeing the giant spinning spit full of pork and the other various meats being freshly prepared behind the counter. The process was simple: place your order at the counter, have a brief sit, and wait for your glorious meal to be procured at the counter. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

"$3.50 for a single taco? That seems a bit muc... Oh... oh my"

This was pretty much my exact thought process as I watched the patrons in front of me get their order. Make no mistake - these tacos are absolutely massive. See that picture at the bottom of this review? Two tacos, although there may as well be four there. Considering the portion size and the menu breadth Street Tacos prices are nothing short of extraordinary given that this is San Francisco we're talking about, and value like that should be shouted from the mountain tops. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Oh yeah. I hinted as much in the beginning of this review, but these were some of the better authentic tacos I've had. Period. 

I opted for a steak taco and an al pastor taco, and my only regret was that I wasn't able to sample even more of the wonderful meats available at Street Taco. These were some of the freshest ingredients in the game, and they were served in generous quantities bundles together in freshly made tortillas. I'm usually not one for large quantities of salsa or cilantro, but both made the meats work all the more, and the aggregate flavor was excellent if I haven't already made that clear. Marvelous. Dual Stars Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Without question or hesitation. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
Came to use the bathroom! We were walking along Haight Ashbury, we had to go super bad and this was the only place we thought had a public restroom available. Not sure if you have to order food in order to use the bathroom, but we didn't care, nature calls! 

You order at the counter. I ordered a two street taco plate. I thought it was pricey for just two tacos, but I figured it must have a side of rice and beans. Nope, it was just two tacos. It's $7 for two but I ordered one with shrimp, which was a $1 extra. When our order came out, I wasn't impressed, the taco with shrimp had barely any shrimp, but a lot of shredded lettuce. The taco with carne Asada, was decent but I've had better back home, at a fraction of a cost. 

My disappointment is with their bathroom. It's only one stall. We had to pee super bad and the lighting sucks ass! My biggest gripe is that the toilet seat is off its hinges. Along with dim light, try wiping your ass on a wobbly seat. I almost fell off the seat, kinda gross when the boys get pee everywhere but in the commode! No Bueno! Put a repair order in, por favor, ASAP! You don't want someone busting their ass, trying to wipe it!
author: Micki M.

description:
This place was bumping. Lineups the whole time I was there. Given the good I am pretty surprised. There aren't too many options in the area so I guess that is why.
Burrito was pretty bland. The spicy sauce was awesome but I basically had to drown my burrito in it so it would taste good.
author: Stuart A.

description:
The food is amazing. A very simple menu with so many meat choices is what shines.

Cons: Only a handful of tables but people seem to come and go quickly if you're okay with waiting a few.
author: Angela J.

description: Best tacos I've ever had!! My friends got the burritos and they were also delighted with the taste, we will for sure be back when in the area.
author: Rosa K.

description: Very delicious tacos- fresh with lots of options. Great little place in the upper haight.
author: K C.

description:
On a rainy day there's nothing like a burrito, I ordered it through door dash, the burrito got delivered in a timely manner and was still relatively warm.

I ordered the super burrito with campechano, black beans and everything else it came with.  Let me start be saying that the black beans were nowhere to be found, this burrito was mostly rice and campechano, smh not so super for a super burrito.  Overall the flavor were good, however if we're doing the farolito comparison farolito definitely comes out on top.

If I'm in the haight and I desperately want a burrito I'll probably stop by, however if I can I'd make the strech to the mission and go to la tequeria, el farolito or even taqueria cancun to fully satisfy my craving, however if those options are not feasible this place will do.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Came here for lunch before going on bike riding.
They have a board menu by the entrance that you can check out before you go inside the restaurant. Of course they have the boars menu by the cashier as well since thats where you will order your food at before you dine in or take it to go.

Ready to order...they won't cook your food until you place your order by the cashier
They made your food quick...but i did came right on time before the the restaurant got full/busy.
Super burrito with steak for $8.95. Seems like they give okay amount of meat. and also tacos which comes in 2 for $7. Got chicken for both tacos. Since its in tortilla, they fill the chickens to the edge. But I thought the prices for both items are pricy. The foods are pretty average and had decent amount of flavor.
author: Julie N.

description:
Had a 930pm CRAVING for nachos so I made my way over here.  I'm almost sure they add msg.

I ordered nachos with marinated pork and horchata. My dish was overly salty and had a killer headache afterwards.  So sad, because this was my favourite place for nachos.
author: Angelica C.

description: Good Mexican street food.  Had the street salad with guacamole and add chicken.  Good fresh greens, delicious guacamole and generous portion of grilled chicken.  Will be coming back.
author: Timothy O.

description: Great Al pastor done to perfection on a rotisserie. I like their street bowls because of the crispy chip like combo and add rice. Getting a table is never too long of a wait, usually about the time it takes to get your food.
author: Lucas P.

description:
I think the food has gone downhill a bit since they've opened. Food is OK, not great. 

Service is still quick.
author: Tim W.

description: Best refried beans in town. I don't care for flour tortillas because they taste like play-doh, so I always order the tacos.  Their corn tortillas are perfect:  soft, flavorful, and not too thick. They also have a good selection of wonderful salsas. So whenever I stop by to order for take-away, I order tacos and an extra side of refried beans, to have the next morning with fried eggs and avocado.
author: Saskia Fiona S.

description: I'm giving 2 star because the food is ok. The proprietor (older gentleman at register) had issues with the credit card machine and even though it said approved he ran out of paper and didn't seem to know how to refill and started to run the card again. We had to pull up the bank app before he would let us take the food. He tried to double charge and was a huge dick about it. The place is an absolute mess trash everywhere. If you want a good taco do yourself a favor. Go elsewhere! Or get charged double.
author: Brian G.

description: I really love tacos and this spot makes me happy every time! They slice the meat fresh and it has a bit more an authenticity taste you might expect for a place like this. Also tasty beer here.
author: Guadalupe S.

description:
4.5 stars. Phenomenal tacos, especially alambres taco (chicken or beef with cheese, and I had the chicken one). The fish taco was so so - I had ones with fresher fish from LA or other places in SF. 

Part of what makes the tacos fantastic is the salsa - just nothing but balance, fresh herbs, and burst of flavors.  The spicy one definitely have a kick. The jalapeños pepper that one could get on the side is super fresh and flavorful. 

The chips also looked amazing, very thin and not too greasy - bet that it's pretty amazing with the salsa.
author: Rebecca C.

description: This is the perfect place to go when you have that intense hunger that can only be satisfied with rich, flavorful, authentic Mexican food. It's quickly prepared, no nonsense, and delicious. It also has a very reasonable price point, which is rare here.
author: Richard C.

description:
Hands down the best quesadilla I've ever had. 

I came at lunch time on a Wednesday and while this place was busy, I was in and out in less than 10 minutes. Crazy. 

However, if you're looking for a place to sit at lunch time, forget it. There's probably about 10-12 tables but they were all packed. 

Maybe it was the salsa. Maybe it was the guacamole. But my quesadilla was amazing and I will definitely be back. And the free chips and salsa were an added bonus!
author: Sarah A.

description:
I lived in San Jose for a few years and almost weekly would grab street tacos from a cart down the road. These aren't that street, but still quick and affordable on Haight.

While I was originally in the area for the Haight Ashbury Festival, and was ogling the various fair food, you sometimes just want to sit and eat. And out of the temperature that fluctuated by block. When we arrived the place was nigh-packed, but there was no line to order. Right afterwards that changed, so look at us beating the crowd.

I'm used to seeing carne asada, pollo y carnitas at taco places. What I hadn't seen before was costilla. So got an order of tacos, one costilla, one pastor because they had the rotating meat hunk that I really just want to steal and spend a day eating it on the couch.

The pastor was good, but I really enjoyed the costilla. Would definitely get again.

Speaking of what to get again, the people who sat next to my friend and I got the street bowl and wow. That was huge, had plenty of meat, and seemed like a great deal.
author: Michael C.

description:
We came to The Haight on a Wednesday night (our first trip to SF from San Diego). 
When it comes to tacos- us San Diegans get real picky. I've heard stories about San Diegans ordering burritos in the Bay Area/ Northern Cali & they're just not the same. So, to avoid all of that- I personally avoided ordering one & went straight for the tacos.
Clean/ loud atmosphere- Giants vs Dodgers game on tv. 
I saw the wine glasses hanging on the racks on the back wall- no liquor license, just for display. Womp Womp.
I ordered the Costilla, Campechano, & Asada tacos. And I was not disappointed. When we arrived at Street Taco- it was probably 9:30pm ish. And the loads of meat on my tacos were heaping. That impressed me. Even the homemade tortillas! You know a spot is the real deal when they've got homemade tortillas.
And the salsas! Fuhgetaboutit. They were bomb.com 
Definitely worth a visit.
author: Joanne P.

description:
I came here on 02.24.2017 with a friend for burritos and I got a carne asada burrito.  Despite with the price posted on Yelp by other reviewer, mine priced @ 8.75 for a regular, with tax: 9.52.  Not cheap.  And well, tasted alright.   Nothing to wow for.  Shoud've gone to Gordo on 9th avenue instead.  But that's another review coming :).

Service was normal, not bad and since I always count the service experience into the review, the 3 star is what I decided of.

Should I come back for another burrito?  After I visit other 100s of taquerias in the City, then I might :).
author: Cu K.

description:
Food: 5/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5

After a busy day of shopping in the Haight/Ashbury area, we stopped here for a quick bite to eat before dinner. The quick bite to eat turned into a full meal itself. We each ordered the tacos ($7), I had the carnitas and my friend had the beef steak. It includes two tacos each with a side of nachos to share. You're given little plastic cups to refill your own sauces and salsas at the front with self-serve water available. The tacos were delicious and not skimpy on the meat portions. The salsa verde was EXCELLENT. I kept lathering it onto my tacos and nachos like a fiend. 

We kept looking around at the other tables and admiring the portion sizes of everyone's quesadllas and burritos. They're massive. We watched as one guy casually stood his burrito upright (without it tipping over) as he took a break from eating. 

Glad we stopped in here!
author: Jennie Y.

description: I got a grilled fish(pescado) super burrito with no beans. It was pretty good and I ate it all. I didn't like their green salsa. It tasted weird compared to other restaurants. Before i left, the guy at the counter reprimanded me for using a cup to contain the salsa. I didn't see their small containers. He was kind of rude and stared at me weird. He didn't smile and thank me for coming. I don't know if I'll be back. I can get some cheap Mexican food elsewhere on Haight.
author: Denise C.

description:
Nachos, nachos, nachos
The tacos are seriously great-super flavorful on homemade tortillas- but we come for the nachos. 
Best nachos in the city. Maybe the best we have ever had.
Black beans, pico, cheese, tons or guac and sour cream. Simple ingredients but they do them perfectly. When they ask what kind of meat, say no thank you. Don't bother. They're that good. 
Tho the tacos are really good and we get an order of al pastor when we are feeling super piggy. 
And we see tons of people getting the taco bowl also. 
We pop into Street Tacos and get our meal and bring it next door to Hobson's. 
Nachos and rum punches. 
The new brunch and mimosas. 
Friendly staff. It is always packed but you never wait long
Their salsas are awesome. The green is our fav. Killer picked jalapenos, onions, and carrots, too.
The manager seems to always be there on the side overlooking everything and making sure customers have what they need. His people work hard, and they don't have time to refill those pickled jalapenos. So he will pop is and make sure everything is full and clean.
There is water jug and cups out for people to help themselves, which I love. We are often coming here after walking around in the city all day, so popping in and having some water while we wait for our order is always nice.
It's a small place, but there is some seating. Don't know if I would ever eat here just because it does get so crowded. Love getting my food and hitting the bar.
We can never say no when we are in the area.
There are a few good restaurants in the area, but dude, nachos and rum punches. Trust me.
author: Kat R.

description:
Food is so good here! Portions are pretty large and everything looks and tastes great. There's a salsa bar on the side of the restaurant as well, and you can fill up your own small containers to eat with your meal.

The line was a bit long and it took a while to get through it, since it gets pretty crowded around dinner time! The restaurant doesn't have that many tables either, so most of them were full. And unfortunately, they ran out of guacamole when I was there, but they gave a hefty portion of avocado with my burrito instead. 

Regardless, the food was still really good and I would definitely it recommend if you're looking for some yummy tacos or burritos in the area!
author: Kathy C.

description: Currently eating here first time and I've enjoyed my meal. Ordered a burrito with shrimp. Taste great but kinda pricey. 10 dollars so that's why 4 stars instead of 5 but over great tasting place
author: Leel W.

description: This place is incredible! Was brought in here with a friend, I am so impressed with the freshness of the ingredients, quality of the meats and guac, and the flavors of the sauces. Not to mention the space itself was so clean and appealing. I tend to avoid eating in the Haight I have been disappointed all to much in this neighborhood when it comes to grubbing so thank you Street Taco for being an Oasis over here!  (I am in the mission  and I will say this place is a refreshing  change of pace from the typical Mission Taquerias  exuding a run-down aesthetic  on the verge of failing an upcoming food inspection.
author: Morgan S.

description: The food was so good.  Went right before noon on a Sunday.  Not too crowded.  Good quick service .  Hit the taco bowl and a burrito both tasted awesome.  Free salsa and water.  Very affordable
author: Kyle L.

description: I was able to get two meals out of a super carne asada burrito. It was really good and filling. They let you pick what type of beans, meat, and salsa you'd like; however, it would have been better with cilantro. Overall, it was very tasty though.
author: Bernadette T.

description: We stumbled upon this place by chance while taking one of those dreaded San Francisco bus tours.  We ordered a variety of tacos and they were terrific across the board, certainly the equal of most of the good taco places in Los Angeles.  I couldn't figure out where to get those little salsa cups so I can't comment on their sauces.  The service was reasonably quick. It's simple fare, so there's not much more that needs to be said.  Recommended.
author: Jonas A.

description:
Street Taco
SF The Haight
3pm Wednesday 15th April 2015
Four Stars 

I don't know if Mexican food in NY is just so bad or if this was delicious. I ordered the Cesar Salad ($6.5) with Al pastor (+2.5). The food came out quick. The menu stated romaine with cotija cheese and pico de gallo but the salad felt more out of the bag including the gross croutons. The pork however was plentiful and outrageously delicious. The flavorful marinated juicy meat combined with the sweetness of the pineapple was tongue pleasing combination. 

Their burritos look huge. Next time.
author: Leonard L.

description: I pass by this place atleast 3-4 times a week but never had the urge to try it . On Haight St there are so many options and so much going on that a lot of times I'm overwhelmed and resort to my go tos like escape from New York or that parada Puerto Rican place . Today I decided to grab lunch before I left the city and I told myself I would just park anywhere on haight and eat at the closest establishment . I'm so happy it ended up to be Street Tacos . No lie this is some of the best tacos I've ever had . The meat here is top notch . You can tell just by looking at the meat that you're in for a treat . They cook and make the tacos right in front of you . The al pastor is freshly sliced off one of those meat rotisserie things and it is DELICIOUS . My second taco was the shrimp and man were they generous with that perfectly cooked and season camarones. I can't wait to come back here and try the other meat options . Only draw back here is the price . It's five dollars for a seafood taco and 4 for a regular one but y'all it is worth it especially if you appreciate quality food .
author: Toan T.

description: Completely flavorless. I doused my taco salad in two types of salsa and still, no flavor. The fish tastes like airplane food and the carne Asada was bland. I didn't think Mexican food could be flavorless, but Street Taco proved me wrong.
author: I S.

description: All in all, I just love this place. I come to this place at least once whenever I visit SF. The lady that's always working the register is very kind and patient. The food is kind of pricey but the quality of the food and service definitely doesn't leave any space for guilt. I'd recommend getting the street bowl or nachos, too delicious to pass up.
author: Bree S.

description:
Overall nice place, though I was expecting a much better tasting food!

The type of place: You order first then they call your order number when the food is ready. You anywhere you want, anywhere that is available. 

What I liked:
- Strawberry drink!!
- Very nice and friendly personal!
- The place food is relatively cheap for what you get

What needs improvement 
- The food: For a place that is rated 4 stars and a half I was surprised to see that the place was relatively empty! And this was at 12:15 pm - lunch time! Well after I tasted the food I understood why: if you do not choose the super spicy option, the food has so little taste! The ingredients were healthy (avocado, tomatoes, beans, etc.) though no taste!
author: Gilbert B.

description: Fire good! Quick. Good service. Nice & good selection of food and salsa's. I will definitely come back.
author: Matt B.

description: Pretty good food but the staff was really friendly! Nice, clean place, tvs to watch sports what more can you ask for!
author: Raymond P.

description:
A friend recommended this place, so I stood in line during the Bay to Breakers madness. The line was about a half hour, but once I ordered, my carnitas super burrito took no time to come out. They had onions, green salsa, red salsa, and habanero salsa as the self-serve condiments. The burrito was huge and came with chips.

While the burrito was tasty, it wasn't particularly flavorful. I ordered spicy, but it wasn't hot at all.  The carnitas were mildly seasoned and very tender.  I wouldn't get super burrito with the carnitas. The extras sapped away some of the flavor.
author: Monique S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were in Haight for some errands, and we decided to stop in here for a quick bite.

There was a little bit of a line, but I didn't have to wait long because they were fast and efficient.

I ordered the street bowl with carne asada and sour cream. It was very good. The meat that they used was flavorful and chewy, but not the type of chewy where you get tired of eating it because it melts in your mouth. You could tell they made the tortilla shells because it didn't look store bought.

The place is small, but it's clean.

I'll definitely have to come back and order something else because I want to try everything!
author: Sunny O.

description: One of my favorite taco spots in the city.  Authentic Mexico City street tacos, my favorites are with al pastor and camarones.  The place is tiny, but still bigger than a street taco vendor and there are a few tables to sit at.  It's usually always  a long line, but definitely worth the wait.
author: Clarissa S.

description: You don't need to go to the mission anymore for a great SF burrito. Street Taco is good. Real good. Not only is the food great, but the people who work here are too. Hearty delicious food at good prices. What more could ya want?
author: Wendy X.

description:
My go to place for Mexican food. Delicious and large portions. They have lots of selections from tacos, to burritos, to fried taco shell bowls. They also have a huuuge selection of meats and a variety of salsas. I have gone with my parents and take my friends to visit if they are looking for a good quick bite.

There's usually a place to sit and the people that work there are super friendly.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
Just a couple very good reasons to come here.

1. You're just too far away from the sights and sounds of the neighborhood that is more associated with Hispanic food.

2. You need a homemade flour tortilla.

If both conditions are met, you'll find a friend in the quesadillas here. Don't opt for the burrito because the tortilla is extra special when grilled. The fillings are decent, with the rib meat being the tastiest. It's also the owner's fav for what it's worth.

Go nuts on the salsas. Them's tasty suckers.

Really more of a 3.5 but rounding up.
author: Andrew R.

description: The tacos are delicious! We ordered a carne asada and a chicken taco. The kids split a buritto with beans, cheese, rice and meat. It was big enough for them. The meat had good flavor and the tortillas tasted fresh and homemade. The salsas were spicy. My favorite was the green salsa. The workers were friendly and fast. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Boo L.

description: Don't know about their other items, but the carnitas burrito was awful! The pork was terrible!
author: Land Of Makebelieve Y.

description:
Came here once before and was sorely disappointed by the prices and food itself. Everywhere else I typically go for breakfast/lunch was closed due to it being New Year's Day, so I decided to give this place another shot.

Maybe it's because I'm from San Diego, or maybe it's cause there's plenty of other good Mexican food in the city (though Upper Haight, admittedly, is not a great area for it), but I find the fare at Street Taco to be exceptionally boring. The prices are pretty standard as far as Mexican food in the city is concerned ($8.75-10 for a burrito) but the flavor is just not there, making it a really poor deal in the end. 

My boyfriend got the street bowl w/ carne asada and I had a regular burrito with the rib meat (I'm forgetting the Spanish word for it). We were both pretty underwhelmed with our dishes, even the chips tasted chalky and under-salted. Only had a few bites of my burrito before I wrapped it up and took it home, hoping I'll be hungry enough to withstand its basic af flavor later.

I want to love this place. The staff is so friendly, I love the signs/menu/overall branding, and I only live two blocks away from Street Taco, but the food is criminally boring.

Would much rather take a 7 minute bus ride to The Little Chihuahua on Divisadero for a fail-safe burrito.
author: Megan D.

description: Yumm! This place has a delicious meat selection! The al pastor (marinated pork) nachos are flaaaaaaaame! They also have a clean bathroom and complimentary water! I most definitely suggest eating here! If I lived nearby I'd eat here everyday! Sooo good!
author: Whitney E.

description: Fresh tortillas made in house. Well flavored and cooked meat. Pickled jalepenos/carrots/onions and green salsa appeared to be house made. Lots to like here. Which is why it was so surprising and disappointing that the pics de gallo and guacamole tasted like they came out of a package from a store. Guac especially tasted like that crap that comes out of a vac sealed bag.
author: Jasper P.

description: Absolutely loved the location with easy access and close parking. Service was good and food was fresh and flavorful. Casual atmosphere and affordable. I would highly recommend!
author: Sherrie H.

description: A very nice surprise to find authentic street tacos on Haight!!! These are fantastic! Just like the streets of Mexico!!!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Really fresh ingredients. You can taste the quality right away. I think it's a bit pricey but hey that's San Franscisco for you. Super bomby drinks. I got the watermelon
author: Glacier M.

description:
From the smell when you walk in the door to the vibrant, clean, and energetic atmosphere when you make your way through the line, u can just tell this place was going to be a winner.  Came to try the guac, but wound up upgrading to the beef nachos--CORRECTNESS

Beef was savory and soft. Perfectly cooked and the fresh crispy corn tortillas and the happy refried beans, are going to make my uber driver pay big on the way back to union square.

Don't forget to grab a seat quick because it fills up quickly.

THATS STREET!!
author: Mark K.

description: Great vegetarian fare.  We had a vegetarian bowl and carne asada tacos. Salsa was good.  Service fast.
author: Michael B.

description: This by far is good MEXICAN food! My burrito was not what I expected by the reveiws. The meat had no flavor, actually none of it had no flavor at all, and the clumps of sour cream, gross. Lettuce in burrito is not by far in street mexican food! Nothing but, the tortilla chips were good...Never again
author: LPthang S.

description:
Solid Mexican option in the super touristy Haight-Ashbury area! 

Came here one time while showing around  a friend from Japan. He loves Haight-Ashbury and also wanted to get as much Mexican food as he possibly could while he was in California, so we ended up here! 

It was really good though I have to say. Not the best I've ever had but definitely is better than Chipotle or your standard Mexican options in the Bay Area. I usually opt for a few carnitas or al pastor tacos. Their tortillas and pork are really fresh. Salsa bar is on point too. After a long day of walking through vintage stores, this place is great for a quick culinary pick me up.
author: Courtney C.

description: Great little spot if you're going to be in the Hate Ashberry area San Francisco great little spot reasonable. Check it out!
author: Derrick M.

description: Waiting for ten minutes for a clean table... asked the cashier if someone can clean the tables but apparently this place doesn't hire someone for that position. Salsa and condiments are also empty. If the front is this dirty I wonder how clean the back kitchen is! I know they advertise "street food" but I figured it would be on a "clean" table
author: Arash H.

description:
I went here solely b'coz of its name. Strolling and shopping on Haight can make you hungry... so in we went. there was a fairly long line... which is always a good sign! I was pretty surprised at the menu options... a great variety of meats for tacos, burritos, etc. 

I ordered a campechano and al pastor taco and they didn't skimp on the meat! these tacos were full of flavor. meat was savory. they're a lil bigger than your average street taco, so it was filling (for me). The kid ordered a bowl with pescado with all the fixins. She loved it... she said the fish was tasty and everything was just all around appetizing.
author: Gina M.

description:
If you're craving Mexican food on Haight this place is your best bet. It's a small place, gets a little packed but still is one of my favorite spots because of how good their food is. The line gets pretty long sometimes and people constantly come in but what do you expect from a good taco place! 

We ordered a super burrito, carne asada nachos and the chips and guacamole. We expected the chips and guac to be a lot smaller for its price but we got a huge plate. I was happy with the portion but too full to finish my nachos. So 10/10 on the food. A lot of people order quesadillas too so gotta try that next time. 

The place is a very casual and chill place to hangout with friends, family or your significant other. Def stop by here if you're hungry and roaming around Haight.
author: Anne F.

description: This place was amazing.  I had the most delicious and huge taco salad (in a really yummy tostada bowl).  I got the carnitas.  Amazing!  Huge portions.  Small and tight place with long line but was totally worth it after a long walking tour in very hot weather.  We were starving and this place exceeded our expectations.
author: M A.

description: Great array of options and tasty food at a quick pace. Love the fish option- very different and well made.
author: Leila S.

description:
Super causal, bright, taco spot on Haight. 

They have a ton of options- huge variety of meats + salsas. The tacos are larger than average; they are very generous on the meat. The nachos are scrumptious,, too! Be careful not to order too much. It's a great bang for your buck.  

It is a new restaurant- bright, clean and fresh atmosphere. Great spot to stop and eat as you are exploring Haight street.
author: Caroline L.

description:
The reviews aren't lying! After spending a morning walking around the eclectic shops on Haight St. I went into this taco shop for lunch. At first everything seemed a bit pricey ($7 for 2 tacos?!) but I soon found out why.

The place itself is pretty small so I could see how it can easily get overcrowded during lunch time, but they are pretty efficient in taking and getting your order to you.
