They offer tacos, burritos, and taco salads with tons of meat options (veggie options available too!). I ended up ordering a carne asada and al pastor taco. When I got my food I realized why it cost $7 and actually felt like it was a steal. This place does not skimp on the meat. I probably easily had 4-5 oz of meat on EACH taco! It was insane and it was a joke trying to actually fold the tortilla to eat them like a taco. 

Onto the taste. The carne asada was pretty good, but not the most flavorful I've had. The al pastor, on the other hand, was incredible. Extremely juicy and flavorful!

I would definitely go back the next time I'm in that neighborhood!
author: Jimmy C.

description: I went with a group of friends one Saturday evening & although it looked crazy busy inside, it was definitely worth giving it a chance. They have a great price point for the quality, the staff is all very friendly and helpful, and food was out super fast even given how full the place was (tip: get the guacamole, it's amazing!!). I even accidentally left my purse there on our way out and the staff grabbed & kept it until the next morning when they reopened, and not a thing was misplaced  A+ for food, customer service & satisfaction. I can definitely see why my friends were raving about this place!!
author: Maia B.

description:
TL:DR = Best Mexican food in Upper Haight, GOD AWFUL logistics and waiting times.

Hands down the best Mexican option in Upper Haight. The meat here always tastes pretty fresh and they give you a ton of it. The prices are reasonable considering how expensive everything in San Francisco is. I've tried all the uber-hyped places in the Mission and I honestly prefer this place.  

I'm taking away one star though because HOLY SHIT does the line here move slow. This place is a logistical clusterfuck. There is only one cash register, and I swear to god they are using some credit card processing system from the 1980s. It takes freaking forever to order, swipe your credit card, wait for it to process, sign it, and then return it. I've abandoned this place so many times because of the line. I swear their business would at least double if they invested in Square or some other processing system.

Also, you pick up the food at the register, so you have to constantly cut in and annoy everyone in line to get your food. 

Finally, I've literally been coming here 3-4 times per week for 2 years now (don't judge :P), and they still never say hi or acknowledge me. Sad :(.
author: Charles H.

description:
Good Stuff! We are vegetarians and decided to drop in .  We went there pretty late and despite this found all tables occupied. Lucky for us , a few folks were done by the time we got our orders. Not sure if we would have been lucky enough if we went there earlier. 

ordered the Street Bowl and the veggie Tacos (they didn't have the cactus) - overall, the food was great and the salsas were delicious. We asked for the food to be made spicy but it just wasn't spicy  - a minor gripe. 

Overall, happy with the food !
author: aditi g.

description:
Decent burrito, but comparatively to La Tacqueria, Farolito and food trucks like Señor Sisig it just doesn't cut it.

It's a good option if you're in the area but definitely not worth going out of your way for. 

I had the Alambre Burrito which was good. The tortilla bowls which some friends ordered also seemed tasty.
author: Sep N.

description: Solid street style taco joint. Good variety of meats. Simple menu. Even with a line service was quick. Pescado, pollo and carne Asada tacos all good. Guacamole a little watery.  Worth a stop if in the Haight.
author: Roger Q.

description: In the middle of the bustling Haight Ashbury section of town is an oasis of the finest Mexico City street tacos around. The music, the tortillas, the salsas, the guacamole, and of course, the tacos themselves, were spot on. We felt like we had traveled to Mexico City the moment we sat down. Words do little to describe what it feels like to travel home to the DF via a taco. An absolute feast for the senses. Provecho!
author: Laura Maria R.

description:
AMAZING BURRITO. Probably the best burrito I've ever had--carne asada but they had lots of options.

Such a chill spot and definitely authentic.
Reasonably priced and centrally located in the haight.
author: Gina M.

description: We had the tacos and nachos with a side of beans and the beans we're DELICIOUS! They had home made tortillas, salsa was good, good music playing, and bottled coke just like in Mexico!
author: Christina F.

description: I would say this place is a *tinge* more elevated than your typical local burrito spot. If eating in, I get the grilled fish tacos but I pop in fairly regularly for a to-go carne asada super burrito (with a side of their amazing green salsa). I love that they have black beans as an option and their guacamole is also top notch. We have a couple of other burrito options on Haight St, but this place is my favorite.
author: Molly S.

description:
Very good Tacos and Burritos that we tried.
Price is good and portion is generous.
Took away 1 star due to the fact that it's hard to get much salsa to go with the dishes. They allow customers to take salsa in really really tiny cups. Not only that the owner/manager was watching you. If you are taking too much salsa you may get scolded - no joke

Yikes!!!
author: Anton N.

description: Giant nachos, huge tacos, tons of meat, trompo pastor! The salsas are really good too, none too spicy
author: Alfredo N.

description: Had to come back to Street Taco when I was in the area because they always come through. On a scale of hunger from 1-10, a solid 8. I ordered a carne asada super burrito and, well, I must say it did not disappoint. I'm three-quarters of the way through that monstrosity and I am extremely satisfied. My friend enjoyed two plates of street tacos and that was a challenge for him - they have great, generous plate sizes of delectable foods. Highly recommend.
author: Mika A.

description:
Such an amazing place to grab a quick meal after some shopping around Haight St. Having not eaten for around eight hours, I was becoming extremely hangry and in dire need of something filling. My boyfriend, who has apparently been here before (good food without me?? D: ), recommended for me to try it. 

As it is a relatively small restaurant, there are only ~7 choices, all pretty standard (tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc.). I decided on the Carnitas Super Burrito because I wanted to treat myself hehe. 

The food itself is great, and the portions--amazing. I personally am not a fan of burritos because of the tortilla, but the ratio of insides to tortilla was soooo massive that I totally forgot about it. In addition, can we talk about the beautiful wrapping of this burrito??? The foil is so perfect I'm so in awe like what brand of foil does this place use?? I'm still baffled. 

In another sense, the service was great. The service here at Street Taco is the kind that isn't super in your face (constantly asking questions and whatnot), but it isn't detached and indifferent. It's a nice happy middle that makes you feel like you were treated nicely, but not bothered. It was a refreshing change. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anybody. The service is nice, food comes out quick, and it's very filling. I hope to come back!
author: Lailinda X.

description: A couple of weeks ago I tried to go to Baker Beach but like a dork I missed the exit and went to Sausalito.  On the way back home I really wanted tacos so I checked out yelp and found this place.  I got a parking spot right across the street!  I got one al pastor and one campenchano taco and the salsa was soooo good.  The only complaint is that the place is so small and they don't have the chips out for you to grab, but it might be because of the location.  Really good place!
author: Regina B.

description: Ate here a ton during the summer and it was always really good. Menu is relatively simple, and the food is ready pretty quickly. Also, you can go to Hobson's Choice next door for a drink and order from Street Taco through them. Gets a bit busy on the weekends but it's definitely worth it!
author: Nick H.

description:
Finally made it around to trying this place.

I got the regular burrito $8 with castillo (beef rib) +$1, black beans, and spicy salsa on a flour tortilla.

Pleasantly surprised by the flavor! Super tasty and the ratios were just right. Next time, add avocado :) and extra spicy salsa from the bar.

To-go order came with chips +1 (im used to TLC charging) and I didn't hate the tortilla like other reviews state. Portion was just right -- I ate the whole burrito and all of the chips! Best burrito in the haight area I've had.
author: Britt M.

description: I hear the Mission is getting gentrified, which means the street taco secret is out. Killer ingredients, fresh flavors, giant portions - it's everything we love about Mexican and American food.
author: Em L.

description:
Love Street Taco. Friends live down the street, and I walk over once a week. I always get the nachos - no beans, add onions & cilantro. Place is always happening, service usually on point.

Last time I went, ordered my nachos with carne asada. Ordered from the owner/main manager.  
Get my order, walk back to my friends house. Open up, and they somehow forgot to put cheese on the nachos. 

Later evening, I had seen the owner packing up his car for the night when I return, so there were three or 4 employees. Line is long, I go to the front with receipt in hand and let them know. She points at the receipt and says, you had requested no beans. I said, yes, but there is no cheese. They all looked at each other, looked at me oddly, had a mini conversation, threw the cheeseless batch away, and didn't say a word to me. No apology, no we'll have your new order ready shortly, nothing at all. I just walked to the side and waited. Few minutes later, they hand it to me like it was my first order, no words.

Having to come back to a restaurant to let them know that they had forgotten cheese, on nachos, and not even be extended an apology for the mistake or return trip, left me a bit annoyed.

I'll be back eventually...
author: Michael L.

description: Disappointed highly in this place.. I order sour cream and extra on the side. I was charged two dollars. I received my burrito and didn't receive any in my burrito. I went back and waited in line and told her they forgot so I went back in line and told me to show her the burrito. I showed her and said I ate it already. All I did was cut the burrito in half to share and no sour cream.
author: Abdullah M.

description:
Great carne asada tacos- at generous portions. The horchata is also fantastic! Went here with a group of friends and the service was fast and friendly!

The area was clean and well kept. Everything from the chicken tacos, carne asada, quesadillas, to guac and chips--It was great!
author: Sophie P.

description: I went here for lunch and had a super burrito with carnitas. The burrito is very large and almost hard to finish but very good. The carnitas were very soft and flavorful. With my order I received tortilla chips. I was given 3 small dip dishes for salsa, which was self serve. They had different kinds to choose from. I also purchased flavored water in Melon flavor and it was delicious. Very affordable! It is very small restaurant with not much seating room but defiantly worth going.
author: Rose G.

description: Wow, don't think, don't look for other Mexican food, don't even look for any other food, just come to Street Taco and have their tacos. They're 2 per serving, served on delicious corn tortillas, and are absolutely amazing. I just ate here for the first time and got their shrimp tacos with added sour cream and avocado, and I just about died from tongue pleasure. Admittedly, they're not street taco price (more expensive), but they're well worth it. Can't wait to eat here again!
author: Christian D.

description:
I went to this place to get a burrito. Got carne asada and it was pretty hard. Not what I would expect from a 4.5 star restaurant. 
Horchata was pretty good, but cost $4.50 while burritos were $9.95 each.
author: Eziz T.

description: Excellent tacos. Burritos, I'll pass. Nice people with quick service.
author: Richard R.

description: Excellent burritos!! Tasted the pollo and al pastor ones. Laaaarge portions! Little taqueria but very charming!
author: Camille D.

description: Don't waste your time with the tacos. They are way too basic and it costs 3 dollars to add meat and 1 for guac or sour cream. The quesadillas were delicious though, definitely get those!
author: Kimber M.

description: Food was good and came out fast. I got the street tacos but was not impressed they only give one tortilla with each taco making the left over meat a bit difficult to eat. I gave three stars as there is little seating, the bathroom was a horrible mess and the lack of an additional taco shell.
author: Adam C.

description: I visited SF in March 2016, my friend took me here. The food was amazing! They give you huge portions! They might be a little pricey, I'm from NJ so pricey here and on SF may be vastly different lol. But the cost is well worth it. The burrito had a ton of flavor, the ingredients were very fresh, I wish they could deliver to New Jersey lol.
author: Carl C.

description:
Two words: CRISPY CARNITAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Go here and order 2 or 3 carnitas tacos. OMFG crispy pork heaven!!!!!!!!!!!
author: EJ P.

description: Top 3 Mexican spot in SF and I've tried a lot. Anytime I'm near the Haight Street Taco is a must stop. 5 stars
author: Chad B.

description: Great and tasty food. Good spot to take a break and grab  something quick during shopping.
author: Gin C.

description: Not going to lie, I was kind of "eh" about eating at a taco shop that didn't have a Spanish word in its name. But please after you go shopping on Ashbury you need to stop here! We split an al pastor super burrito, you know how I roll! We also had super nachos which were incredible!
author: Roo G.

description:
I'm not used to paying $7 for two street tacos (more like ~$1 per taco) but I guess everything is pricier in the bay area.  

The carne asada was edible but not that great.  The carnitas was better but still nothing special.  The tacos are bigger than regular street tacos but I didn't think it was worth the price.
author: Heejin L.

description: Food is bland. Salsa is not hot. Seems more like white washed mex food. I'd rather go to Taco Bell. The green salsa Tate's like watered down avocado.
author: John Q.

description: This is my go-to Mexican place in the neighborhood. I tend to alternate between the tacos and burritos, with nachos thrown in occasionally for variety, and I've never gotten anything bad. Lots of meat options, with the carnitas being my favorite (very flavorful). The line tends to be long, especially on the weekends, but they do a good job of moving people through quickly. Only real complaint is that the salsa options tend to be lacking - they just have a couple of bowls to serve yourself from at the counter, and they're often empty. Salsa cups are sometimes in short supply as well.
author: Pat M.

description: This is my first time to try this restaurent. I came with my friend Gabby after work and wanted some mexican food. I found Street Taco and Yelp and had pretty good reviews and high ratings. I wanted to get tacos but i found it to be expensive ( 2 tacos for $7-$9) and i was very hungry. Im a big guy 2 tacos are not enough for me. If it was 3 tacos for $7-$9 then it would make more sense to me. I got the super burrito instead for $8.95 with a side of chips for couple extra $. The super burrito was freshly made and delicious. It has your choice of meat (i chose carne asada), rice, beans, cheese, guacamole, sour cream, lettuce and salsa. It was delicious and very fulfilling. I would definitely come again when im craving some authentic mexican food.
author: Jaafar L.

description:
The purple onion salsa is great! (Coming from one who dislikes onions)

Tacos de asada were bomb! The meat was super tasty especialy with the hand made tortilla. 

Quesadilla with meat is huge! Two can share if not super hungry. 

Price wasnt to bas either for the portions
author: Jeanette B.

description:
Carnitas and al pastor tacos were my favorite. Meat quality on the pollo and carne asada were also good but flavor on those two was lacking for me...

Their ordering setup is kind of a mess. You order and pay, but they have no pickup area and don't bring your food out to you. They generally just put each individual dish up on top of the chip warmer light next to the cash register when they make them, but they mostly don't announce which order number they belong to and even if you figure out something is one of yours, you have to push past the person currently ordering to get it... They really need a better system.

Nice little space otherwise, clean and modern, though very casual (plastic plates). They have two TVs showing the games.

Overall I will probably come back here, and maybe another experience will change my mind, but for now I'd call this "A-OK", not a bad option, but not something I'd come out of my way for.
author: Ely L.

description: Great food! Authentic Mexican, friendly staff, couldn't have picked a better place to eat.
author: Diana M.

description: Great spot! Ordered tacos one all pastor and the other carnitas. Both were amazing! They also have a TV for the game. My while party and myself all enjoyed our visit!
author: Joseph T.

description:
Best mexican in the area. Period. (Sorry Little Chihuahua, I still love you and will visit).

The meat here is amazing. The marinated pork is slow roasting on one of those things for gyro meat. Daaaammm sooo gooood!

Chicken Alhambra is good too with the extra peppers and spices.

I've gotten burritos, quesadillas and taco salads. They were all great, I'm sure anything you get there will be.
author: Ross H.

description:
Excellent little taco joint. I had the carnitas and short rib tacos - both were excellent. You really can't beat the price and the staff was friendly and fast. Best tacos I've had in SF so far.

Will definitely be back!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Yum yum...nothing beats a 10am taco!
Hot, fresh and delicious. Loved the front open to the street!
author: Matt And Cathy G.

description: Shopping on Haight, Black Friday, wandering from shop to shop. We got hungry and I had a hankering for tacos but we didn't want to leave, we wanted food we could walk to. Did a quick Yelp search and landed at Street Taco. Holy mole! This place is the real deal. Like a taco truck in a shop. It's quick, cheap and so delicious. I got a burrito and didn't want to stop eating it but got full. The guacamole was fantastic. Food comes out quick, the seating turns over fast enough to get a seat but it gets really busy here. The perfect shopping pit stop!
author: Angelique L.

description: I thought these taco's were great!!! A great little joint in the Haight and Ashbury district! A little on the pricey side, but I was filled up by it!
author: Elise K.

description:
Yum. Good amount of spice, but wish there were more dynamic flavors (I got the shrimp and the fish tacos).

Seating was pretty busy so I took it home. Will definitely be back for more quick bites to eat!
author: Victoria C.

description:
I barely gave this place 1-star bc of location and interior design. I'd like to believe they actually made an honest attempt here, but sadly the price your paying for a very low quality meal here goes towards the restaurants' lease. 

Mesmerized by the beauty Al Pastor tacos rolling through heat lamp with pineapple on top I licked the drool off my chops and ordered a pair of these bad boys in my haste for a whopping $7!!! That's by the most I've ever paid for a pair of street tacos and sadly was let down on all levels. I was SICK instantly, to say the least...and will NEVER be returning!
author: Stacey L.

description: Nice place to eat tacos in sf. The customers here are mostly regular one I think. I like the way they make tacos here. I think it's different than others.
author: Surya R.

description:
Fantastic option for Mexican food if you are in the Haight area. It's reasonably priced and all of their tortillas are hand-made. Yum! They also have a great salsa bar.

I've been here twice. The first time, I got the caesar salad with chicken. It was filling and delicious. The cotija cheese was a nice touch. The cook forgot to pico de gallo in my salad but once I notified them about it, they gladly put it in my salad. 

The second time, I got the carnitas and carne asada tacos. I was wowed by the amount of meat in the tacos. I loved the carne asada tacos and I really enjoyed the carnitas tacos, however the carnitas was a little too salty.
author: Hana K.

description:
Street Taco is so delicious! It's a tiny little place where Askew used to be. I got the al pastor nachos and they were really tasty. The nachos were piled high with toppings. They have 3 self-serve salsas (go for the tomatillo) on the side too. I definitely prefer this place over Zona Rosa!

If you're in the Upper Haight and are craving some good Mexican fare, this is your place!
author: Tammy T.

description: Got the nachos and hibiscus water and it was great! Very authentic - their red salsa is better than the green. I asked about the spicy level of their salsas and they gave me a small bowl of chips to try them. The line wasn't too long but took long but the food didn't take long to arrive. Overall one of my favorite places we ate at while visiting the area. I'm Mexican and from LA where we have plenty of taco/Mexican food places and this place is overall one of the best I've ever had!
author: Tania H.

description:
We had the grilled chicken and fish tacos. $7.00/order gets you 2. Meat is juicy and they load it up. The tortilla is very fresh and homemade. So soft and supple. 

Very clean facility with an open kitchen. 

There's no mirror in the bathroom.
author: Julie L.

description: Their tacos are bomb.com! For only $7, they give you two tacos topped with HUGE portions of meat. Honestly, it's enough meat that other places would use for 3-4 regular tacos--clearly, this place does not skimp on their meat. The meat was tender, tasty, and topped with regular street taco fixings, which made it an overall amazing and delicious value. The homemade tortillas and selections of salsas only elevated the experience. Definitely will be visiting this place again!
author: Emily G.

description: I got the Carne Asada Street Burrito. Burrito was good, but nothing stood out specifically.
author: J P.

description: Enjoyed a great lunch at Street Taco! The service was great...ordered at the counter, food came out quickly, grabbed a seat (even though it's a little cramped inside). The menu is easy to understand. I ordered a carne asada super burrito and chips with guac and Mexican Cokes to share with my wife. Everything tastes fresh and the portions were huge. We struggled to finish the entire burrito!
author: Tawny A.

description: I would give 3 stars if it wasn't so expensive, granted it's in a super trendy spot. I would not recommend going here as there are far better taco spots nearby, for half the price.
author: George P.

description: Their Nachos (+meat) serves ~2 people and it's so good. Everything tastes fresh and warm. The burritos are also really good! Very clean, nice staff, and for the store being on Haight, the prices are reasonable. Their menu is by the door so you know what they have before you walk in!  Give it a try if you are on Haight.
author: Soo L.

description: The meats are so tender and delicious. I ordered a carnitas quesadilla the first time I came here. normally if I get Mexican food, I don't get quesadillas because that seems like a more conventional and boring option. But the carnitas quesadilla was phenomenal and totally something to rave about. Since then, I've also had their burritos and tacos and it's always excellent. It's true that the best Mexican food in SF is in the Mission, but this place is definitely worth a trip to the Haight! I highly suggest getting your food to go (since seating is pretty tight inside) and sitting in the Panhandle to eat!
author: Connie K.

description:
Street Taco-open two weeks, number of visits for me-seven! 
I do work in the hood, and this place is a clean and fresh welcome addition to the Haight. Everything is super fresh made in house with good size serving portions. They even make the corn tortillas to order! 
The Al Pastor is awesome, sliced right off the rotisserie! But the secret item on the menu is THE ALAMBRES! (meat option) "chicken or beef peppers & cheese" there's nothing there about bacon but it is packed with BACON, and it's amazing! I've only had it in taco form but I'm sure the can do it with any menu option. Next time you're in the Haight doing some shopping do yourself a favor and go eat that Alambres!
author: O. S.

description: Excellent Food!  Cool atmosphere.  Brought our four kids in with us for dinner and they were very accomodating.
author: Charlie G.

description:
Street Taco is an odd name for a tacqueria that doesn't serve lenqua, brains, tripes..  fillings the usual grilled chicken, beef, fish, and shrimp. tacos: 2/$7., fish/shrimp: 2/$9

eats: al pastor, carne asada taco, 2/7
-lots of freshly grilled meats, topped with minimum salsa, cilantro, onions.
-good value.
-salsa available on counter

takeouts:
-just 10ish tables for dine-in.
-open grill, can see everything
-tortillas freshly made on site. thick ones, probably flour
author: Victor G.

description: This is a very, very good taco joint. The best on Haight street IMO. It's a bit fancier than the mission style places like Zona Rosa and so the prices are a bit higher, too. But it's still a good deal. There isn't much seating for the line of people you're likely to encounter. That's the trade off. So, eat your taco and make room for the next guy or the prices will have to go up.
author: david b.

description: Pretty good tacos. More on the pricier side but worth it, I guess. I got the fish and shrimp tacos which were really good. Pretty yummy tacos but nothing to die for
author: Rachel K.

description:
After years of terrible taquerias in the Haight we finally have one that does an excellent job. Everything to come out is delicious, but special attention is deserved for having a proper spit for authentic al pastor.

It's not the best in the city, but it's definitely the best in the neighborhood. And most of the surrounding ones as well.
author: Mark S.

description:
TL;DR: excellent tacos, boring burritos.  Eat tacos here.

Street Taco has had a sign up and paper in the windows for months now.  We all thought it was going to be a nonstarter.  But now it's finally open, and we got to try it out.  You could tell it was new; the staff were having trouble coordinating.  The owner and his father (or uncle) took our orders, which means they gave us free aquas frescas.

Now, when the menu first went up I had to admit to some disappointment; it looked like every other darned taqueria in the city, including burritos and quesdillas and other San Francisco food. There were a lot of different tacos on the menu though.  Two for $7 or $9 if they're seafood, which people have complained about as expensive, but they're really not, especially considering what rents are like on Haight Street.

So we ordered six: one nopales, one fish, one shrimp, one grilled vegetables, and two carnitas.  First tip: each order is two tacos, but they can be two different ones.  Mix-and-match!

When the tacos showed up, we realized that we'd ordered too much: these are huge.  My fish taco was an entire small tilapia fillet. The tortillas are the nice handmade-style ones, thick, scortched in places, and capable of standing up to the tacos' enormous payloads.  Each taco was simple, with only a few ingredients and some salsa, but well done.  Ratings per taco:

* Fish: excellent
* Shrimp: great
* Roasted veggies: eh
* Nopales: very good
* Carnitas: OK

So, given the big menu of great tacos, why do they even serve burritos?  I'm not sure.  I guess the owner was worried that people would walk out if they couldn't get a burrito.  But you don't want the burritos;  they're the same steam-table stuffed tortillas served across the street.  Get tacos.

Anyway, I'm really happy they're finally open and Street Taco adds a valuable new option to the Haight. They're like the cheaper, more accessible version of Padrecito a few blocks away.  They should have beer soon, which will make them even more fun.

Oh, and if the owner is reading this: please do a 3 for $10 taco plate (or $12 for seafood).  Two isn't quite enough and four is too many.   I'm stuffed.
author: Josh B.

description:
New lunch spot in the Haight?  I'm in!  If I were the owner of El Faro (across the street) I would be very scared.  Street Taco has all the taqueria basics covered at a super reasonable price point ($7 for two tacos, $9 super burritos) with significantly higher quality ingredients and a more modern vibe than your average taco place.

I've only been here once (this review was written on their second day of business).  I got two tacos: one carne asada and the other al pastor.  Both were super tasty and flavorful if a bit under-salted (I'll give them a pass on this since they were clearly still figuring some things out and they at least had salt and pepper on the tables).  The service was impressively fast for being as busy as they were, especially considering how new they are.

All-in-all this is a welcome addition to the hood.  Lots of meat options, tasty seafood, a couple of veggie options and great prices.  It just might be the best Mexican lunch in the Haight.
author: Hank H.

description: Not sure what happened, but the burrito I got from them today was pretty much inedible. I had to stop eating it because almost every piece of pork (I got an al pastor super burrito) was chewy/fatty/sinewy :( I was pretty disappointed considering I've had a tasty burrito from them before!
author: Meg L.

description:
FIVE STARS. 

I stumbled upon this Mexican restaurant and was blown away! This place is a MUST...Street Taco has the BEST burritos and vegetarian nachos I have ever had. (Mind you-I am super picky with my Mexican food) I absolutely love this place and I cannot wait to go back.
author: Kuldeep B.

description: Yesterday around 4pm my friend and I went here for some burritos. I'm vegan so I ordered the regular burrito with grilled veggies and added guac. After waiting in line for 25 minutes to order and another 30 for our food I finally went up to the counter and checked on the status of our order. Apparently they called it out once and put it to the side because no one came (the restaurant was very loud). All of this was not that big of a deal but what got me was biting into my veggie burrito and finding myself chewing on a piece of chicken. It was only one piece but still it was there. I'm pretty upset that they could make such a mistake. They also left out the salsa that is suppose to come on the burrito and the guac (that I was charged for). The vegetables were overcooked and flavorless. Will not be coming back. This level of food contamination is unacceptable especially in a place like San Francisco where there are many people who do not eat meat.
author: Caroline M.

description:
I'm resigned to the fact that I have to fly to DF to get a truly delicious taco al pastor. But if I'm craving a taco in SF, this is where I'm going. 

Handmade corn tortillas, the al pastor spit, friendly and fast service - this place is the best. 

I hope they add pineapple to the Jarritos soda selection.
author: Esther C.

description: Every time I've passed street taco they've had a long line and seats full of people, which is always a good sign. My roommate goes to Street Taco at least once a week so I figured I'd give it a try... I got a street bowl with chicken and it was delish! The menu allows for you to basically make any combination you want. When I go back next time I want a burrito! Or maybe tacos... Hmmmm but the street bowl was definitely a treat. I ate half the bowl literally, hahaha.
author: Shannon C.

description: The tacos were Amazing! We had the fish (huge fillet), shrimp, chicken, and chorizo&beef. All were perfectly seasoned and delicious. Will definitely return!
author: John U.

description:
The food here is phenomenal and the selection of meats alone will surely please any fans of Mexican food. Only complaint I have is that there is limited seating and the line can be a bit slow-moving at times. 

More details about the meal: I had an al pastor (marinated pork) super burrito and it was easily one of the best burritos I've had in my lifetime. My girlfriend ordered the fish tacos and was also very pleased. 

Definitely stop by here if craving Mexican and in the neighborhood.
author: Martin F.

description: Their al pastor tacos... so meaty and amazing flavors. I obviously don't have pics because I ate them in a blink of an eye. So so so good. Highly recommend. Also I'm a picky picky taco eater.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Had the Street Bowl, essentially a taco salad, and it was everything I could ask for. So glad to have a great taco place close to home.

A++ Will eat again.
author: John L.

description: Omg so glad I found this place ! The al pastor and carnitas tacos are the best. The meat is very juicy and tender. Delicious tacos! My friend ordered the quesadilla and was not disappointed! The quesadillas are loaded with meat, guac, sour team and salsa. Prices range between $7-$11.
author: Katherine H.

description: The beef taco is amazing! A nice little restaurant in the Haight neighborhood. Lots of locals haha. Love it!!
author: Wandi C.

description:
So far so good!  I went twice tonight within three hours (and thus couldn't check in twice) and had the shrimp taco & steak taco, then later the al pastor & chorizo.  Shrimp was tops, but it was all good.  I think they're overloading the tortillas right now while they're still in this early phase, but it doesn't matter.  Best tacos in The Haight.

P.S. They're allowing BYOB while their alcohol license is in-process.
author: Travis J.

description: Got the nachos, they were great!  Carnitas was flavorful and they didn't skimp on the cheese.  Quick in and out, small dining area but it moves quickly so don't be too intimidated if there is a line.  No fountain soda, but they had cans and come in bottles.
author: Amy N.

description: Amazing food! Cooked fresh in front of you, and they stuff the tacos! Everything smells and tastes great!! Will go there every time I'm in SF!! Inexpensive and great service. Al Pastor tacos are my favorite so far. I'm the bald dude who came in early today and ordered the 4 tacos...almost went for 6!  Your food is soooo good! Can't wait to bring family and friends to try it also.
author: Johnny D.

description: This completed our SF vacation. Had the carnitas super burrito and the campechano (chorizo and beef) quesadillas. Like other reviews said the meat portions are generous and I'd for sure get the campechano again. The salsas (3 different types) are delicious and wake up your meal. The corn chips are very crunchy and good to wipe up any spillage! Awesome meal
author: Nicole K.

description:
Street Taco is a decent Mexican Food place. I went in at about 1pm during the week. They weren't too crowded and I was able to order quickly and find a decent seat. 

I ordered the Super Burrito, which came with meat, beans, rice, guacamole and cheese. For $8.50 it was big and pretty tasty. I devoured it pretty quickly. 

On a side note, staff was friendly and my burrito was made pretty quickly. Restaurant was also not in the best of the area (lots of homeless around and I didn't feel too safe walking around the streets here alone, which is the first for me in the city). 

I would come back here again if I was in the area, but would not go out of my way to come here. 

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: Ginormous tacos that are cheap and delicious! Had the carnitas and carne asada tacos. The meat was just spilling out of the housemate corn tortillas. Incredible! Two of those tacos for $7! And I topped it off with a refreshing watermelon agua fresca.
author: Nina S L.

description: I'm a San Diegan. Their San Diego style burrito is plain terrible. Just don't order it if you've ever had a Burrito in San Diego. I don't know why they even bother advertising/making their San Diego style burrito. The pico de gallo and the guacamole in the burrito were all sorts of wrong. The tortilla was gummy.  Just don't make it if you can't make it properly...
author: Linda D.

description: For a spot that isn't very authentic like the hole in the wall spots in the Mission, this place ain't bad.  It's definitely my go-to for Mexican food in the Haight/Ashbury area.  Good service, friendly folks!
author: Don A.

description: This is the best burrito in San Francisco - yes even on par with Mission burritos. They also have incredible service and all 4 of their specialty salsas are to die for. Their Al Pastor is my favorite - the best!
author: Charlie B.

description:
My daughter works at a Tex-Mex restaurant back home so we eat a lot of Mexican food. She commented how good this place is and I have to agree. 
Very reasonably priced as well
author: James P.

description: This place is bomb. Delicious burritos, tacos, and horchata. Their salsas are fresh and the have pickled jalepenos and onions available. Their super burrito is huge definitely two meals for me. I recommend the pescado tacos sooo good. I have also tried the asada, carnitas, and pastor all great. Their prices are reasonable too! This place is casual . It's a good stop for a quick bite to eat with a few friends. Not great for a larger group. They have tables of seat 4 and 2.
author: Lauren R.

description: Absolutely delicious and the perfect lunch stop. Homemade to order corn tortillas were thick and tasty. Highly recommend the carne asada tacos with the hot salsa and guac (SO good.) They also have Mexican coke (aka the best) and give you complimentary chips and salsa and cups for water. Would definitely return.
author: Cara S.

description:
Was doing some shopping on Haight Street and kept walking by this place so decided to check it out. And boy was it worth it! 

I ordered the carne asada tacos and chips/guacamole for take-out. The tacos were so delicious and had plenty of meat. The chips and guacamole for very good as well. 

Next time I am in the area, I will definitely be back as everything on the menu looked amazing!
author: Megan R.

description:
Great food, great price...even the locals eat here. We go here when we do our thrift shopping and then we walk it off :)

The staff is nice.  They have a salsa bar. 
I usually get the shrimp super burrito and my kids get fish tacos and steak tacos. Great portions.
author: Nora R.

description:
I can tell right away that they want nothing but thee best, Got two tacos and I fell in love. 
Handmade tortillas, great pico de gallo, and wonderful service. Sometimes the simple things are the best things. 

They serve alcohol and Mexican bottled sodas! 
I looked around, saw the quesadillas and nachos they also looked really good, I MUST frequent this place. 
They may not have a large varying menu but what they have is the best of quality.

The only downside is that I wish it was more of a sit down dinner place, but alas even aside from that it's very enjoyable. Noisy as expected for the area. Great for take out and lunch
author: Gabriel M.

description: Bf and I split a quesadilla with chicken ($10.50.) Thank goodness we split it, because it was big. Unless you are really starving, it's too much for one. It had plenty of tasty chicken, cheese, and guacamole and sour cream inside. It was very good. In fact, bf said it was the best quesadilla he's ever had. Besides that, the nachos looked amazing. They also had a bathroom, which a lot of the small restaurants don't seem to have. I would be a regular here, if I were local.
author: Jessica S.

description:
So far so good!  I went twice tonight within three hours (and thus couldn't check in twice) and had the shrimp taco & steak taco, then later the al pastor & chorizo.  Shrimp was tops, but it was all good.  I think they're overloading the tortillas right now while they're still in this early phase, but it doesn't matter.  Best tacos in The Haight.

P.S. They're allowing BYOB while their alcohol license is in-process.
author: Robert W.

description:
I really LOVE this place.  Every single time I have eaten here, it has been very enjoyable.  Their carne asada is pretty close to perfect, honestly the best I've had in a long time, and they fry it up fresh right in front of you, not scooped from a warm metal bucket.  The salsas are yum, too.  

It's an affordable and CLEAN place on Haight Street, a very welcome addition.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Stopped here unplanned for a quick little snack because we were shopping around and hungry. The 4 of us all ordered carne asada, comes with 2 with each order so we each ate one. The setting is nice but it's pretty difficult to find an empty table. It came out really fast, took less than ten minutes. Man, everything about the tacos we got was perfect. The meat is super tender and the tortillas weren't too corny, which I like a lot. And the flavor was bomb. They have some sauces on the side that you can get and all of it together is SOOO good. Some of the best tacos I've had! We ordered even more.
author: Aimee E.

description: Coming from San Diego I was hesitant to try Mexican food north of L.A., but this place changed my mind about NorCal Mexican food. Absolutely delicious food. Although a big portion, I recommend the nachos
author: Nikki D.

description:
We like this place for two reasons:
1st and most important - they're open on Sunday nights when we get take-out.
2- The burritos are pretty good and they do have whole wheat tortillas

It's hard to beat the Mission when it comes to burritos, but they try hard at Street Taco. I just wish they had boiled chicken. 
The place is always buzzing, and they're fairly fast in making up the orders. Not too much room to wait. 
Ambiance: Haight Street, people who can afford the $10/per burrito price tag.
author: Eileen A.

description: Stopped in on a bike ride to the bridge for a quick bite and were happily surprised with a delicious meal! Street bowls are filling and absolutely delicious. We tried the beef and chorizo (with rice for an extra 50 cents)  and would definitely recommend the strawberry agua fresca for the perfect refreshing but not too sweet thirst quencher.  Service was fast and friendly too!
author: Gina L.

description: Best tacos of my life, by far. I couldn't even believe how good what I was eating was..it was like out of body good...this is worth a trip from anywhere!! Thank you for that experience street taco! I love you.
author: Alisa M.

description: I like Street Taco. I used to come frequently when I lived nearby. Burritos and tacos are good, but my favorite thing is the carnitas nachos. So much food and delicious. There are a few options for salsas, and you can get containers by the register. Service is friendly and quick. There are a few tvs that usually have sports on. I prefer to get take-out because it can be crowded depending on the time of day.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Got the chicken tacos and they were soooooo good. Homemade tortillas and fresh meat!! Chips and Salsa are good too!
author: kent v.

description:
Being from SoCal, my expectations were not terribly high going to a Mexican restaurant; frankly, I had no idea what to expect. Plus, most of the places in this district (Haight-Ashbury) seemed pretty less than exciting. However, this place could not have further surpassed my expectations. Their food was fresh, flavorful, and exceptional. In fact, I don't believe that SoCal fast-food type Mexican places match this quality. I'll definitely return. Their guacamole was excellent, their chicken well spiced, and the strawberry drink was killer. 

I will be back.
author: None O.

description: For being in the Bay, not a bad taco spot. Street taco's plain and simple, just the way it should be.
author: Wesley T.

description:
Best tacos in San Francisco! Fresh handmade tortillas, fresh juicy and tender meat, really good salsa! Just loved the food. I would really recommended to anyone that loves tacos. 

I would recommend to the restaurant that they keep and eye on their restroom and keep it clean :)
author: Claudia O.

description: The food was delicious! They were not stingy on the amount of meat they put in their food, and for the price it was just plain amazing. There is a constant line, so people must agree and love the food just as much. The only downfall is for how busy it is their is not a large amount of seating available.
author: Olya M.

description: Really liked this place. Late dinner pit stop with the bf. Very authentic choices for meat. The tacos were amazing. We had al pastor and carnitas in our tacos, both fantastic. My bf had a chorizo quesadilla which was fantastic as well. And we split nachos too with our roommate. We had the beef and chorizo combo on the nachos which I cant remember the name but was also really good.
author: Hilary S.

description: The food is great but the flow of service is infuriating. They set the dishes on a heat lamp near the register and if you hear your number called out over the loud music you have to push thru the line to get it. I've burned my hand a few times trying to pick up my plate. A re-design doesn't seem that hard.
author: Leda M.

description:
Food in the Haight can be a dicey proposition, unless you are up for a slice and even then... Street Taco is a pleasant surprise and absolutely kicks the competition's ass across the street (rhymes with wheelbarrow)

I've only had the burritos, I don't tend to fuss with tacos or nachos much.  So, consider that...but I've officially had all of them now with the exception of the veggie because, really, why? 

You can taste the quality in the meats and hand made tortillas. The selection isn't unusually large but 4 more than SF's typically woeful burrito representation of the regular, super and veggie. The carne asada is pretty standard, nothing to get a tattoo over. They add lettuce and rice to every burrito, so say something if that bugs you. I like it actually. Same with the chicken and carnitas, good quality but nothing mind blowing. The Campenchana is where things get interesting. It's a mix of the carne asada and chorizo sausage. The slight hint of cinnamon makes this a special thing of beauty and my go to every time. Second favorite, the Alambres, peppers and onions with your choice of chicken or beef and a touch of bacon. Masterpiece.

Place is clean, staff is very nice and it's a great place for people watching. Be warned though, the word is out and lunch is busy. Be ready to wait in line around noon.  Plus prices are very fair for the area.

My only minor, teensy weensy complaint is the salsa. There are 3 and while flavorful none of them carry the punch I crave. Bring your own if you're a freak like me.

Oh and try the spicy carrots and jalapeños, one of the best I've had without being mushy.
author: Mark C.

description: Absolutely love their super burritos! Al pastor is my favorite, and there's is super tasty. I know Mexican food, and I understand this place is 100% hole in the wall type of place, and a taaad bit Americanized, but still does the trick!
author: Liz F.

description: Yummy carne azada quesadilla, good salsa, and tasty agua de horchata :)
author: Marisol S.

description: I stopped in the other day for a burrito to go. When I reached the front of the line to place my order, the cashier Maria seemed extremely annoyed by my special requests; no cheese, sour cream, or meat and extra beans, which doesn't seem too complicated to me. She even told me, "don't you see we are busy, I don't have time for this!" Mind you, there were about 6 people waiting in line. Since I live in the neighborhood and I like to spend my money at the local businesses, it blew my mind that she didn't have time for my business or money. She also looked extremely miserable as I encouraged her to smile a little. It saddens me to say but, I will not be returning to this establishment for any of my future burrito cravings.
author: Gianna B.

description: Love the pastor meat here. Love this place. If u go to height st and like Mexican food.  U will love this place.
author: April F.

description: Just passing by and found this amazing place for Mexican foods. Must try it when you want to visit this area. 5 Stars!
author: Can G.

description:
High quality ingredients make their tacos simply delicious. 
It was rather busy when we tried this place (Saturday afternoon), but our order was ready quickly and the place itself was very clean as well.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Fast, friendly and really good authentic Mexican food. Homemade flour tortillas were so good with the camarónes, and the al pastor. Little pricey but total worth it.
author: Dee F.

description:
I have found my go-to for Mexican food. Tasty high quality ingredients prepared with care and served up by friendly staff. 

The carnitas are really good, carved fresh.

I judge my burritos by the beans and rice. They got it right.

Other dishes looked yummy; I will be back to try.

Decent dining area; if you are a fan, the Giants will be on. Awesome.

Family friendly.
author: E F.

description: We were craving Mexican food and came across this place on Yelp. Waited about 20 min in line and then 5 min for food. Ordered two super burritos. One chicken and one steak. Really good food! There was no where to sit but we took it to go. Could tell it's a popular place!! Very pleased with our lunch :)
author: Tara T.

description: I recently moved to the Haight and this place has quickly become my go-to burrito spot. The food is tasty and less greasy than your average taqueria, which makes it all go down a bit easier. Really friendly staff as well make the experience wonderful. It's quick, tasty, and filling. What more do you want in a grab-n-go burrito joint?
author: Mike S.

description: This place makes the best burritos this side of the city.  It has really fresh ingredients including seafood/shrimp.  They provide plenty of good veggies as well.  The portion sizes are really favorable as well.  The ordering area could be better arranged, but they can whip through a ton of orders quickly.  The staff is really friendly too.
author: Ryan I.

description: Incredible! Best tacos I've had in a long time since living in Mexico City! Al Pastor all the way. Fresco y rica!!
author: Peter M.

description: Very authentic Mexican food! A little overpriced in my opinion but very good and filling!!
author: Taylor L.

description: It's a good place for a quick lunch of you feel like having Mexican when on haight street, not expensive and big portions, service is quite pleasant and the environment feels like proper mexican
author: Alberto G.

description: Staff is really nice and helpful, the salsas are good and portions are good for the price however, the food just isn't that great. It all lacks flavor and is overall just kind of bland. Not what I expected from a place named street taco with 4 and a half stars.
author: Sierra S.

description: Really great place. Great customer service . Great tasting meat. Very large portion that has the perfect amount of juice in it. Not too dry, not too wet. Huge pet peeve of mine. Would recommend to everyone.
author: Daniel L.

description: This place is such an awesome find- my boyfriend and I were just driving through the area and when we saw it we knew we had to stop in.  After checking out the Yelp reviews we were REALLY excited.  I got the nachos and he got tacos.  We ate at the stand up bar and although we were trying to savor the food pretty much inhaled it. The only weird thing about this place is the ordering area- they order and hand out food from the same 2 foot area- so it gets very congested.  Overall loved it and will be back!
author: Amanda M.

description: If this place has 4.5 stars then Taco Bell is a 5 star restaurant. Both the Al Pastor and Asada are bland and they really skimp you on the meat. My burrito had an ounce of meat if I was lucky. Nobody cleans the tables. Fortunately service was quick. This place is designed for hipsters who have never had good Mexican food.
author: Darius A.

description: Got the chicken taco. It was ok. I had better. Needs a little more kick to the flavor.
author: Tre' C.

description: Great quality mexican out of the mission! They have a plentiful salsa bar and healthy sized burritos. Nom non nom!
author: Lauren B.

description: This place was pretty good, you got your average meat and beans burrito. I got the "super burrito" that comes with guacamole and sour cream as well. Overall it was pretty decent, but didn't make me say "Wow". My reaction was more like an "oh ok". If I could give three and a half, I would, but that's not an option.
author: Ari F.

description: Very good and more than just your ordinary Mexican street taco in my opinion - having had many in Mexico.  The horchata was fresh and delicious.  The pork street tacos was very tasty - slow cooked with a lot of flavor.  Refills on chips and salsa.
author: Liz B.

description:
Regular veggie burrito with pinto beans, rice, cheese, and Mild Salsa for only $4.95

So dank
author: Nathan T.

description: Food was good, not to die for tho. My boyfriend and I love tacos. It would be better if they had double corn tortilla on tacos, a lot of juice in taco for one tortilla.
author: Ashley C.

description: Amazing place. Something for everyone, can make your order vegetarian. Well located on Haight. Monster burritos, skip the beef as others have said. When to the Caribbean restaurant and they bait and switch, go to Street. Good prices, absolute must whenever you come to San Francisco, as is the Haight district.
author: Sabrina R.

description:
This place is located in Haight, service is great and food is delicious!

I love even more Street Taco each time I come here. I highly recommend the quesadilla with Al Pastor meat, mild or spicy, it's delicious!
Quesadilla with carnitas are not bad either!

I've heard from Mexican saying that it tastes like home!
One of the best Mexican in the city!
author: Arnaud H.

description: This is suc a great place to eat! Has touches of a  modern restaurant while also keeping the ambiance of Latino/Hispanic culture alive. Great playlist and great customer service! Coming back for more, for sure
author: Auxiliadora T.

description: This place exceeded my expectations and is one of the only restaurants on Haight St I would actually visit. As it should be with tacos, everything was fresh--the salsa, veggies, and the meat cooked fresh to order. Highly recommend the chorizo.
author: Dale C.

description:
Moving to SF from Texas sounds great... except for the part about tacos.

Well, my every need has been met with this joint. By far the best I've had outside the Lone Star state.

Everything in the menu is worth trying, but my personal favorites are the Al Pastor and the Pescado.

Yummmmmmm!
author: Josh V.

description: Pretty disappointing. The shrimp and fish tacos are way too wet. The tomatoes in the pica de gallo don't seem ripe.
author: James K.

description: My boyfriend has pretty high burrito standards and, while alcohol had been consumed, said the campechano burrito was the best burrito he's ever had. I had the chicken burrito (my go to) and it was A+. The complementary chips are pretty solid, not too greasy and they don't taste like phony grocery store flour tortilla chips. The cashier guy was really nice too, fast service. 10/10 will go back. Only regret is someone ate my left overs :(
author: Carly M.

description: Really legit, delicious tacos and burritos!  The restaurant is small but the service and, most importantly, the food was incredible.
author: Amanda G.

description: i honestly don't know why this place has really good ratings. Because of the high rating my family and I decided to come here and were very disappointed with the food... I ordered the Nachos and my husband ordered Carne Asada Burrito and they were both nothing special... I've definitely have better nachos and Burritos somewhere else. Service was fine, food was not wow worthy... Won't have to worry about coming back here
author: Anna K.

description: Food is always amazing, sometimes there's a wait but it's all worth it when your food is streaming ready to eat!! I highly suggest this place if you're on the haight
author: Juan S.

description:
The tortilla was somewhat cold on the burrito I had. The flavor was good, except it had too much guacamole and salsa it just made everything mushy. 

The quesadilla was pretty good as well. The small order of chips were somewhat old and hard. Went in on a Sunday night and it was pretty full.
author: Ivan Q.

description:
Really good place with wonderful tacos and a spicy kick! 100% recommended 
Not the usall kind of tacos but they where even better!!
author: Simon S.

description: Im okay with paying 10 bucks for a burrito but not if it keeps my wife up all night with food poisoning. Im not normally a "bad review" kind of guy but thats all she had eaten and we know food poisoning when we see it. Nevertheless, we won't be coming back..
author: Damien L.

description: It's 2am and your cleaning crew has left the music on and it's on full blast. I live above the taco shop: I've called more than 5 times but the voicemail isn't set up. This has affected my sleep more than once. Why can't your cleaning crew shut off the music before they leave? No one is there... I've put a complaint in with the business owners next door. I've  complained about the noise from your establishment multiple times. How can we work together to make sure your customers have a good experience during your business hours but we can still maintain the community peace?
author: Louella A.

description: al pastor wheel....haven't seen another one in SF
author: Andrew H.

description: Our go to spot for tacos and quesdillas. Simple taco spot with bomb salsas. This is a no frills spot...not fusion...not hipster. Just plain tacos. Love their carnitas and carne asada . They have tasty Agua frescas too. The location is small, so it can get packed pretty quickly.
author: gretchen p.

description:
Al Pastor!!!!!! That is all that needs to be said. Try it!
So amazing good. For a while they added pineapple to it which made it even more amazing.

The food is always consistently good. Dare I say it rivals SoCal? Maybe not in authenticity but definitely in yumminess. Please don't hurt me.

Horchata here is really good too.
Great for quick meal days. 

I hope they get their wine/beer license soon. They have taps set up and everything.
author: becca w.

description: My go to place for burritos. The spicy salsa is one the best I've ever had. Glad there's a good Mexican place in the Haight!
author: JS K.

description: Good quality. Good variety. Good prices. Close to home. What a GREAT addition to the upper haight. Street Taco, I think I love you!
author: Ori B.

description: Their taco bowl is delicious and it's so much food. I got one and it was just great. I really like this place. It has a neat feel to it and they were playing the Giants came on the TV. They have a ton of different meat/ veggie options to choose for what kind of taco bowl, burrito, tacos, and etc. you want. I haven't seen that many options in a while. Salsa bar is small, but pretty good. None of the salsas are that spicy. Would totally come back here though. Great place.
author: Julie L.

description: Really good food. Not as spicy as I wanted but I am from Texas so I'm trying not be be too hard on the salsas. Large portions and great customer service. Very friendly and awesome music. Just wish there was something with a little burn.
author: Samantha P.

description: We're regulars. Best burrito in the Haight. Highly recommend the carne asada. Only complaint is their pico de gallo and guacamole could be fresher. Love that they don't hold back on the cheese! Try the hibiscus aguas frescas.
author: Celie H.

description:
Not a review on the food but for customer service.

Had to really use the restroom so we went inside and purchased a soda in exchange. The owner probably new what we had in mind only ordering a soda and asked if we needed to use the bathroom. We replied with a hesitant "yes". He then told us we could go ahead and use the restroom without purchasing anything (with a nice smile). How nice of him! 

If anyone knows Haight street, they know how limited access going to the restroom is. 

My bladder was relieved. 
5 stars for customer service and being just plain nice!
author: Erin A.

description:
Its only place I know of in SF that has homemade masa tortillas for tacos -- something that's commonplace in LA. They really make a difference. 
Also, meat is of excellent quality. Very non-greasy and seemingly healthy compared to other places. The place has got all things right. Love it.
author: Naz V.

description:
How does this place have a 4.5 star rating?

Average food and expensive, even for haight. Had a carne asada super burrito, which was fine, but definitely average. Add to that a $9 price tag you get a 2 star burrito. Usually I get avocado on burritos, but that's an extra $1.75... so $10.75 for a burrito with avocado. Even Chipolte is cheaper than that. 

If you're giving this a 5 star rating, you need to go to more Mexican places. Metate, Taqueria Cancun, and El Castillo have better burritos and much cheaper.
author: Jim T.

description: For a quick bite to eat this is your place.nachos, quesadillas and tacos are all awesome. My favorite being the carne asada and alejambra tacos. Also the portion sizes are huge! For SF- this will def fill you up for $7. I often order Togo from this place as its only a 3-5 min wait.
author: Zoe S.

description:
I created a yelp account to write this review!

As a native San Franciscan, there are two types of great SF burritos in my opinion. First, there are the authentic, don't-ask-their-heath-rating types places (ie. La taq, cancún, farolito etc) and then, what I like to cal the white-boy taquerias (little chihuahua, papalote etc). Both establishments offer a quality product. 

Street tacos is such a breath of fresh air in a neighborhood that shouldn't have to suffer from burrito mediocrity! The upper haight is already home to el faro and zona rosa, both aggressively average taquerias, with zona as the slightly better option. Street tacos is the best of a white boy taqueria--clean tables, well marinated meat, healthier options, with the authenticity of passionate mexican owners. 

So happy to have this new addition to the hood. Can't beat homemade tortillas!
author: SImone S.

description: Love their nachos.. not a fan of their tacos.
author: Errie S.

description: New place in the Haight that I've been wanting to try. Had the super burrito which was pretty good, don't think it can beat the mission Mexican restaurants but definitely the best on Haight, I want to come back to try out the tacos.
author: Josue V.

description: Customer service is great. Food is delicious. The carne Asada nachos is bomb!!!! A must.
author: Ruby Y.

description: This is a great stop for some fine street tacos.  Hot sauce is fantastic. The burritos look filling and delicious.   Enjoy
author: Dave J.

description:
I've had the tacos and the bowl and both were delicious. 
Quality food. 
Giving 4 stars for the price, and for the set up of the order/pick up in the restauraunt.
author: Kayla A.

description:
Great food! 

Great staff ! 

Great location! 

-You must try the chorizo taco! (my fav)

i will be back ! thank you!
author: T. C.

description: Amazing food. Quality proteins. 12 different types of tacos to choose from! They even have cactus tacos!!
author: Douglas B.

description: Best tacos Ive had in a long time hands down! Their meat is fresh and delicious AND their tortillas hand made.  My favorites are Al Pastor and the Carnitas but the Carne Asada is great too! Service is great and the price is reasonable for what they serve u. It says 2 tacos but u could easily make 4... They don't sell beer but their aguas frescas are always a must. Its a small place so expect to wait for a table. Oh and bring a flashlight for the bayhroom its dark in there and there aren't any changing tables for the little ones.
author: Maria M.

description: Good but not great.  I liked the space and the people were super nice but my burrito didn't have much flavor.  Note to self: add extra salsa.
author: Jessiqa P.

description:
Our experience here was a quick one, and everyone knows how generous I usually am in my star-ratings, and maybe it was my own fault for not reading the menu in depth enough, but I hated it.  Poorly punctuated rant over.

My friends and I popped in and ordered a steak quesadilla (which said it came with sour cream, but assumed it would come on the side like every other place on the planet), and chips and guac.

Good news first, the guac wasn't awful, but I've definitely had MUCH MUCH MUCH better, at non-mexican spots nonetheless.

Bad news next; the entire inside of the quesadilla was SMOTHERED in sour cream.  Like if this quesadilla was a human, it would experience death by sour cream drowning.  There was so much sour cream on the inside of this quesadilla that the cheese wasn't even melted to the top tortilla.  My friends and I don't generally like sour cream, and just assumed it was coming on the side.

Lesson of the day:

DO NOT ASSUME.
DO NOT ORDER WITHOUT ASKING QUESTIONS.

I would skip this place all together and try one of the other Mexican joints in the area.
author: Kendall B.

description:
Got a carne asada super burrito, which I've been using as my standard metric for Mexican restaurants. (With pinto beans and hot salsa.)

I ordered takeout as every table was taken--it might partly be due to the place being new, but it was very busy. (It was also a Friday around dinner time). There were 3 or 4 people in front of me in line, which moved quickly. You can see the open grill as you wait, so that kept me entertained.

I soon received my burrito, which came with some tortilla chips, and headed over to eat in the park. I don't do any sort of fancy taste testing of ingredients, just chow down into the burrito and go from there. That's the point of it being wrapped up, I think. Anyways, this was excellent! The steak was perfectly seasoned for my tastes (and nice and tender), the guac tasted fresh, and the pinto beans were in the proper "bean zone" between mushy and firm. 

What really made it stand out was that the salsa actually had a decent spice to it, and there was just enough sour cream to complement that spice. Maybe it's because I'm a gringo or something but I usually finish most burritos wishing it had a bit more spice to it. This one hit the spot! 

For $8, this is a solid lunch or dinner. I've yet to have La Zona Rosa or El Faro yet, so can't make a comparison with other neighborhood eats.
author: Eoin N.

description: New Year's Hangover hunger?! Well, Street Taco was bumping with customers ordering tacos, burritos, quesadillas and nachos on New Year's Day! I was really craving a platter full of yummy nachos with fresh chips, melted cheese, hearty beans, sour cream and guacamole. For an extra $2.50 they can add on meat, fish or shrimp too. It was delicious and hit the spot! Great first meal of the year.
author: Zaina O.

description: Good food, and pretty quick service. Beans are vegan, rice is not. I would have given this place 4/5 stars but the owner is pretty stingy.  My boyfriend and I would always get 2 burritos, and each burrito usually comes with the customary free small bag of chips. Well, the owner would give 1 bag, and we would always have to ask for the second. My boyfriend, who is fluent in Spanish, heard him say in Spanish to his employee, "how many bags of chips did they get?"  Really dude? Now, we go to the other place on Haight, and they don't ever skimp on our chips
author: Rocky B.

description: AMAZING BURRITO!!! When my bf and I found this place for the first time, we went two days straight without hesitation because it was that good. I'll be making this place my main go-to place for burritos. It's cheap and they give you so much. Amazing food!! Staff is friendly also!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Pretty nice tacos! They're pretty generous with the meat and I saw tortillas getting made right in back. 

I got one carnitas and one chorizo taco. My lady pal got a carne asada and al pastor. I forgot which one she preferred but I was totally digging the carnitas. MMm mmm mmm. There's quite a list of meat options, so I'm sure I'll be back. You can't keep me away from a good taco.
author: Loli L.

description: Best place to buy Mexican food on Haight! Everything is super good. Authentic as can be. I always order a burrito and it's always amazing
author: Naasim S.

description:
Yelp is always about reading in between the lines. You can pretty much ignore anyone who voluntarily eats at Zona Rosa/El Faro. You can also ignore anyone who would go into a placed with 'Taco' in the name and order a burrito (if you're wondering why they even have them--go in on a weekend afternoon and it will be filled with tourist families all eating... burritos).

Basically they're decent to good, not great. (go for alambres and campechano--you can get better pastor and carnitas elsewhere). Portion/value are very good on the tacos. Two is definitely enough for a regular meal, equivalent of like 4-5 actual street/truck tacos.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Been coming to the Haight for years now and seen restaurants come and go. Saw this place and came in and was not disappointed!!

Had a Campechano Burrito and I can honestly say it was one of the best I have had in years. Had a piece of a friends chicken quesadilla and that too was really good. The chicken was juicy and full of flavor.

Will hit this place up again next time I'm in town!!
author: Jesse I.

description: Amazing food & service!!! Owner on the floor keeping the restaurant clean. Fish, pork and Arne asada all delicious. Well organized and fast service.  Will definitely be back!
author: Will M.

description: This is your best option on Haight Street for Mexican.
author: Lucullus L.

description: This is probably the best Mexican restaurant I visited. Food is *great* and portions are huge. I tried the chicken and the Veggie quesadillas and are delicious. Moreover, it's super cheap. Definitely a spot in SF.
author: Matías G.

description:
Strangely enough this super commercial looking spot in the Upper Haight has the best restaurant guacamole i've had in a really long time.

The tacos al pastor, carne asada and carnitas are all pretty damn legit.

It's a great place to fuel up before heading to the next thrift shop.
author: Alex W.

description: I used to live in the Outer Richmond and would take the bus just so I can eat here.  Now I live closer and it takes a lot of discipline to not eat here every day.  The ingredients are so fresh and delicious!  I love the tacos and the bowls.  The burritos are also awesome.  I highly recommend this place!  The staff is awesome!
author: Natalie Z.

description: 5 stars well deserved!!! It's an AMAZING Mexican restaurant, probably the best I've ever visit in California. I tried the quesadillas and are delicious!!!! Portions are huge and super cheap. Highly recommended.
author: Consuelo L.

description:
Walked by my new hood and saw the new Mexican joint, "Street Tacos".  Eye Roll.  It's the Haight, how possibly could this be even considered authentic?  With a restaurant named Great Indian Food a block away, I couldn't help but be skeptical.  Plus there was cash only Zona Rosa, the surprisingly hated (but delicious) El Faro, and the hipster (overpriced) Padrecito on Cole and Carl-  the Mexican food scene has become crowded on upper Haight.  Couldn't they open up a decent burger joint, or maybe a sushi or Chinese restuarant?

I came here on a whim to have a "snack" with my cousin to catch up.  Home made corn tortillas for the tacos at 7 bucks for two.  Crispy carnitas (GET CARNITAS) delicious yet not outrageously oily like other taquerias.  Carne Asada tacos and Nachos were massive.  Salsas served in small ramekins, friendly service, clean new spot.

Brand new tables, service with a smile, big screen TV and homemade good-good.

Not bad.  Now please, Haight street.  GET SOME REAL CHINESE FOOD, and we good :)
author: Cat A.

description:
The best damn "taco" place I've been to in California and maybe one of the best in the country, and I've driven across America twice!!! Amazing food at a super amazing price for SF!!! You're missing out if you don't try it!!

***sidenote. Order a burrito and use it to lift weights with.
author: Charley P.

description: Effing amazing!  Get the carnitas tacos and you won't be disappointed ;-). The salsa, the guacamole, the chips, everything!
author: Steve A.

description: Came to what I thought was one of my favorite taquerias after a few months of not having it...very mediocre.
author: Julia A.

description: Tonight I had the pleasure of supporting a good friend of mine a few stores down at an art gallery. As I walked back to my car, I walked past the welcoming aroma of Mexican food only 4 minutes before 10. I walked in hungry and I knew that I had found a nice gem to add to my collection. I order the grilled steak tacos and they were probably the best tacos I've had in a reeeeeeeeally long time. Turns out I managed to walk in as the last customer before closing. I take this as a blessing. A good night ended right with great street tacos. What else could an SF experience need?
author: John S.

description: Delicious. Pork shwarma-style. Nuff said.
author: Ariel C.

description: On a whim, I stopped in for a bite.  Two tacos cost only $7, and they were amazing. Fresh ingredients, authentic flavor, and a wide range of meats, and toppings to boot!  Definitely worth a return visit.
author: Will D.

description:
5 starts for the Authentic Al Pastor meat! One of the very few places that does Al Pastor right; just like the street vendors from Mexico City!

I've been looking for a place in the states that offers anything comparable to real Al Pastor and these dudes do it right!  5 stars for that and the Sidral Mundet Apple soda that's hard to find!
author: Dreski S.

description: Maybe it was an off day, but the burrito I got was just alright! I've had better...but I've also had worse. I got the Pastor super burrito. The meat seemed a little flavorless. In fact, the whole thing was a tad flavorless. I would still go back though, because like I said...maybe an off day.
author: Kray P.

description:
Let's keep this simple, shall we?
Five stars. Muy excellenté!
First of all, they keep the menu basic. Select from taco, burrito, quesadilla, nachos, and a couple salads, then choose your filling. They use top quality ingredients and make everything from scratch. Three salsas (in addition to pico), guacamole, and homemade tortillas. Mmm!
Clean, fast, good service. Someday, beer. 
A little pricey but so worth it!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Had lunch with my girls here. Overall we were pretty happy with the meal. If I had to be more specific our rating would be somewhere between 3 and 4 but closer to 3. 

The prices were a little high but considering the amount of meat you get it makes sense. They charge$7 for two tacos.

Carnitas taco (5) - perfect. Delicious. Flavorful. An ample amount of meet. Actually all the tacos had plenty of meat in them.  For taste, this was my favorite. 

Al Pastor taco (3) - not bad. The meat was prepared in the traditional style on a verticle spit with a pineapple on top. The meet was sliced properly and achieved the perfect amount of carmelization. The only issue was flavor. Something was lacking in the spices. It was too bland. Having eaten these tacos in Merida, Yucatan and at an incredible taco truck in LA, this was nothing close to either of those locations. These are actually my favorite tacos on earth when done right. I was a little disappointed here. They weren't actually bad, just not great.  

Carne Asada Tacos (3) - these were decent. Nothing spectacular but still good.

Meatless Nachos (3) - these were pretty good but got soggy super fast. They said they use sour cream.  Not sure if that was just because they are used to people not knowing the difference between that and Mexican crema. The cheese was not the traditional one but also not that horrible yellow orange 'nacho cheese' sauce. The beans were great.  They give you three options on beans. My favorite will always be black. The girls prefer pinto/refried. 

Horchata (3.5)  - pretty good.

Costilla taco (0) - we ordered this but it was missing from our order so we never got to try it. 

Overall if I am visiting San Francisco again I would not come here to eat. I would rather try another new place or a favorite location. If I lived here I might come back for the carnitas tacos.
author: Maureen T.

description: This place is amazing! There's always a line out the door because they're so good! (the line moves pretty quickly, though!)
author: Steph T.

description: Ordered vegetarian burrito and a few bites in, saw that it contained beef. Went back and after triple checking that they understood what vegetarian means, replaced it with an actual vegetarian burrito- or so I thought. Throughout eating, kept noticing chunks of various meat here and there. Couldn't even finish the thing :(
author: Liz R.

description:
I know mexican food and this is the real deal.  Delicious, inexpensive, generous portions and fast.
The ambiance is noisy and bustling.  I hope they can stay consistent while getting slammed because they will be getting a ton of customers.  I also like the way they greeted me when I came in.  I wish they had napkins on the tables.  Finally great food in the Haight!

Highlights are al pator, carne asada, dark salsa and the fresh tortillas that make the best tacos.
author: Elena G.

description:
Best Mexican food in SF!
Product are good quality, meat is excellent (+1 for Al Pastor with cooked with pineapple), place is clean, cookers and owner are super nice.
Highly recommend the quesadilla with Al Pastor meat :)
author: Laurie M.

description:
3rd time back since opening. New go-to spot for a great taco. 2 for 7.00 dollars. I live in the Haight. & really like the food here. It stands out. 

I've had and endorse:

Marinated pork
Grilled shrimp
Fried pork
Chorizo n beef

The fish tacos look heavenly. Next time!
author: Robert T.

description: This place is one of my favorite places in San Francisco. They have amazing food, great customer service and large portions. You can not go wrong with the el pastor tacos or super burrito. Not to mention the salsa and horchata are home made and amazing as well.
author: Eric M.

description: super burrito is super incredible!! im so full and so happy! Menu is simple and easy to follow, employees were sweet and amicable! They clean tables right away. I love this place!
author: Rachel B.
