description: This is our second time at Taco Club. Staff is welcoming and the food is a good value for money. Spicing is right and the beer is cold. Small space, so parties beyond 4 may be hit or miss. I have only had the tacos and would recommend each (fish, carne asada, & chicken).
author: Chris M.

description: Decent place, but I've had better tacos out on the East coast side. The chicken taco was ok, some flavour but the pico was definitely lacking on the cilantro front. The shrimp taco was super light on flavour, unless all you want is the taste of charred shrimp (not a bad thing, to each their own).
author: Neha G.

description: Great local burrito spot! An added plus that they have wheat & spinach tortilla options.  As a native that grew up in the Mission I know how a good burrito is supposed to taste. This spot reminds me of that.
author: MARIA M.

description:
I was positively surprised by the Nachos (with marinated pork), it had a good amount and a good balance of quality guacamole, salsa and other goodies. The pork was "Shawarma style", which wasn't expected, but wasn't bad either. 

As for the street salad - I was disappointed as it contained way too many beans.
author: Omer G.

description:
I live up the street and have lived here a few years, coming from San Diego. I was never a fan of the other shops on the street, although Zona Rosa's quesadillas are alright. I was cautiously optimistic about this place, but now that I have been there five times in the last couple weeks, I can say this place has what it is I've been waiting for.

The tacos are $7 for 2 ($9 seafood), but they are quite large. I am a large man, so I still need 3 for dinner, but 2 is enough for lunch. I have tried most of the varieties, but I would recommend the Al Pastor, Pollo, and especially the Campechano (beef & chorizo). My lady and I usually go for one Al Pastor, one Campechano, then sometimes split a chicken quesadilla (excellent).

Burritos are quite good, and I usually prefer burritos, but I actually prefer the tacos, quesadillas, and nachos. The tortillas and chips are super fresh and made in-store (I believe). The salsa bar is slightly lacking, but seeing as they actually put enough salsa on the food, you don't really need much outside of a bit for your chips.

As long as they can keep close to the current standard, I will be a loyal regular customer.
author: Nate P.

description: The food is really good, but the atmosphere is completely lacking. It's very small, cramped, little to no decoration, and there was definitely no service with a smile. No complaints about the food what so ever, but wasn't a fun to place to sit and eat.
author: Brooke J.

description: So my boyfriend is currently sitting in a corner devouring his burrito and warning me to "Stay away." Which is fine, because that means I can enjoy mine in peace. I eat burritos constantly, and living in the Haight, I was skeptical of another Mexican restaurant, especially one called "Street Taco." To me, that basically screams "tourist trap." I have never been so happy to be proven wrong. The burritos are delicious, the meat is cooked to perfection, and they don't skimp on cheese, sour cream, and guacamole like some other places do. The place is tiny, but what it lacks in size, it makes up in burrito size and ambiance. It's family owned and operated, and they seem to know what they're doing. I will most definitely be back. I'm already addicted
author: Rebekah H.

description: Great place to grab a quick, cheap bite to eat! You can't go wrong with their super burrito
author: Rachel T.

description:
Came here on a Sunday with a few friends and the place was packed. I ordered a super veggie burrito. The guy at the register was very kind and the guy that handed me my burrito did so while giving the warmest smile, which always makes the food taste a little a better, right? Having said that, the burrito itself was decent, everything tasted right but it was just okay. My friend ordered a grilled shrimp burrito and loved it, maybe it's a sign that I should have gotten a meat of some sort.

I'll probably try their fish tacos next time. After all, ordering tacos at a place called Street Taco sounds like a better plan.
author: Natalie S.

description: These nachos will school you on the BBall courts.  They are bomb. We had the carnitas very good flavor.  Lots of cheese and beans.  But really needed salsa and mas jalapeños.We weren't sure if the salsa was free or not because the cups were kept up by the register. Very confusing.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Their burrito is the best! It will give el faro and zona  roza a run for their money.
So happy this place opened up !
author: Sarah S.

description: If you're looking for authentic Mexican food then this is the place to go. We had the nachos and the super burrito. The homemade tortilla and salsa made the burrito perfect. The atmosphere is lively which is exactly what we wanted.
author: Michael A.

description: This is a quality restaurant with affordable food and so many options! I got the bowl but without the flour crust for a low carb meal and had it with chorizo. It was so good I want another one right now! Will be back soon.
author: Alexander M.

description: Good, not great. Seating is hard but not impossible if you wait around. I don't like that you can't just buy one taco.
author: Amelia D.

description: I went 2 times, took the tacos and the street bowl, a friend of mine the burrito. It was all very tasty and plentiful. Prices are good, everything is under 9$. If I will be again in San Francisco I will return for sure.
author: Matteo S.

description: AL PASTOR holy dankness. Coming from San Diego I know a burrito. This place is as close as it can get  perfectly rolled burrito with all the essentials. Thank god I live next door
author: Mark M.

description: Best burrito shop on Haight.  Balazo was good while it was around but this is better.
author: Jake B.

description: Came here because of the reviews, left a bit disappointed. First we ordered and got our food, but didn't find a seat for 10 minutes due to there only being about 7 tables. The food was good not great, we ordered spicy and it was very bland along with the sauces. Overall it was okay.
author: Neil P.

description: Not sure why this place has such high ratings.  The prices were relatively high ($9 for two pescado tacos).  Plus, the food was unbelievably bland.  The fish, the lettuce, and the taco shell all had no flavor whatsoever, as though they had been washed to the extent of washing the flavor right out.  Despite being rather hungry and having already spent money on the meal, I decided to suck it up as a sunk cost and forego trying to eat any more.  So, after eating about half of one taco, I decided to leave the rest there and go in search of something better.
author: Mary W.

description: We ordered burritos to go, on two separate occasions. Both times, they forgot to add cheese and avocado to my burrito, which we didn't realize until we got home. There was hardly any salsa in the burrito; it's mostly rice and chicken. And there were pieces of steak in my chicken burrito. To add insult to injury, the chips are inedible. We have yet to find an excellent burrito in the Haight.
author: Al A.

description: I love this place! Great tacos, burritos and nachos! I always get the nachos with no meat just beans. I've also enjoyed the street bowl, tons of food. They have a variety of salsas and pickled peppers.
author: Nicole S.

description: This is a good lunch spot. Although it can be a bit crowded and hard to find a table, it's worth the hassle. I like the carne asada tacos and would recommend against the fish tacos.
author: Maya B.

description: Super friendly people working there! This place was packed with families with small children when we visited on Saturday lunch time. I intended to order nachos, but ended up with quesadilla that was delicious!  Fish tacos had huge portion of grilled fish that was filling. Reasonable price, too!
author: Hiroko S.

description: Nice size portion of food. The prices are decent. The salsa is really good. Crowded during day, not much seating. Pretty popular spot I suppose. I would return. I love Mexican
author: Jordan P.

description: Pretty solid place, generous on their meat portions , not so much with the shrimp. My bf got two shrimp tacos and it was basically lettuce. I love their salsas !! I would have liked for their carne Asada to be more flavorful , seems like the carnitas and steal were dry. Cute place, clean and friendly:)
author: Silvia S.

description: Great place to eat. I love the fact that the staff is very caring and lovely they might not be perfect but they really work hard on making the food the best. I also feel very angry that some people that come to this place are very impolite  to the employees sometimes I have seen people coming to this place yelling at the employees or even telling them what  to do like treating  them like a servant.  Come on people just be polite to these people if you were in their shoes you wouldn't last a day working in restaurants, you will really feel how these people  feel the way how you treat  them. Even if you think you are the costumer in you know you are wrong and think that you are right when is not. Just be true to  yourself. Stop behaving like stupids and fighting against these people. I did not intent to write this post to make you feel bad but I intend it to open your eyes and become compassionate.
author: Karen F.

description:
One of the nicest burritos I've ever had! I've really been missing out in Toronto.

Portions are giant. I immediately cancelled my dinner plans halfway through the super burrito!

Menu is simple, straightforward and customisable, which I really like. Staff were friendly. Prices well worth it for the size of the super burrito. Ingredients were super fresh and service was incredibly fast.

Only minor nitpick is that the salsa fell to the end of the burrito, so I got a lump of the stuff when nearly finished, and not enough throughout the rest of the burrito. That seems to be common with Mexican food though!

It's also in one of the coolest neighborhoods in North America. Another reason to visit! 5/5
author: Izzy T.

description: Poor customer service: I came here tonight and got a burrito and a few tacos. The meat was delicious but the tortilla fell apart before I could get a bite. At $3.50 per taco you think they could afford to double the tortilla. I went back up to see what they could wrap it in and i was met with a "I know our tacos are the sh*t so deal with it"  attitude from all 3 workers behind the bar. I've gotten real street tacos for under $2 with more umph than what you'll find here. Delicious meat, neglectful authenticity, negligent customer service.
author: MM M.

description: You can get much better tacos in SF, caters mostly for the Haight street tourists
author: Eyal C.

description:
I stumbled across this restaurant last night pretty late after a day of house hunting and so I wasn't expecting anything great. My roommates and I needed something to eat on the go and happened to come across this joint after finding everything else around the area closed. 

Homie sold me on the al pastor. Told us its been spinning all day and it was looking all fat and juicy like those Shawarma rotisseries. Feeling hungry so I grabbed a burrito, and they know how to wrap. Nothing against Chipotle and other local burrito shops, but I don't like my burrito fat and short. Too difficult to eat, and sometimes they just throw everything together without looking. Street Taco knows whats up. They make this nice long evenly distributed masterpiece that I can hold with one hand. Highly recommend.
author: Cody M.

description: It was ok, I guess. The carne asada was passable, and I did like their salsa bar. It's not worth driving to, but if you lived within walking distance it might occasionally be cool to eat here.
author: Vincent C.

description: Trying out a bunch of places to eat in our new home town. We love our new house in SF and love all the wonderful choices to eat at. Last night was craving Mex food and so glad we picked here. Not long wait tacos were so yummy ! My new favorite for Mexican. Will be back.
author: Jujii F.

description: The food was great! Guacamole was fresh and tasty. Had the carne asada tacos. The meat hardly had fat and was cooked perfectly.
author: Elba G.

description:
If you're looking for some Mexican food around Haight, then... this is the place to be! The restaurant is super cute and also there's different colors on each wall. 

Omar and I got the super burrito and my close friend Juan got the fish and shrimp taco. The food is super fresh and delicious! You can actually taste the freshness.The staff over there is super friendly. I love this place and I definitely recommend it! 

Thanks Juan for treating me for dinner ( If you're looking at this) Thanks :)
author: Debbie C.

description: Being from SoCal tacos are one food that majority of the country so desperately tries to compete with. During our foodie adventure to the oh so fabulous SF, we made a lunch stop at this taco shop. I order the super burrito, which had guac, choice of meat, sour cream, cheese, rice, beans, and pico de gallo. My boyfriend got two tacos de pastor with the works, green salsa, onion, cilantro. I am extremely impressed with their meat! Very good quality and seasoned to perfection! The burrito was huge and delish, although it was super big it was too good to go to waste; I ate it all. Lol! I accompanied my plate with a Mexican Coke, that's always a must. Their combo plates were fantastic, reasonably priced,and I left extremely satisfied. I'll be back once I'm back in San Francisco! Btw Haight & Ashbury is the place to be!
author: Brittany R.

description: If you're a tourist, this place is probably fine. If you're a local, go to The Little Chihuahua or Papalote instead. Food was alright, not great. Chips don't taste fresh. Salsas are not the best. Place was crowded when I went with people just sitting around watching sports on the TV even though they were finished eating. Not a very efficient place, which would be fine if the food were out of this world. But, it's not.
author: Scott H.

description: I shared a plate of nachos with my sister in law. We added carne asada and it was perfect for a light lunch. The meat was seasoned well and the pinto beans tastes like my grandmas! They had different salsas to try. It was crowded so finding a table can be hard and given where it's located you probably don't want to eat outside on a bench or anything. If I'm ever in the area again I would stop here again.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Meh, got the carnitas super burrito. It's okay, but nothing compared to Zona Rosa down on Haight Street. Sorry, these carnitas were bland compared to Zona Rosa.
author: B K.

description: So this place is amazing. We had the super burritos (al pastor and carne adada) and two tacos plus guacamole and chips for three people. Total was $35! The food was excellent. Long line and tables are always full so be patient. The food was more than we could finish, especially the burritos. Definitely coming back.
author: Dan W.

description: This place is amazing! Super fast service and so yummy. Also really reasonable prices!
author: Jordan W.

description: Amazing food, plentiful portions, dedicated staff, reasonable prices. Get the super burrito, you won't be disappointed.
author: Evan D.

description: The meat is cooked perfectly and the burritos are the tits! It's a small place and the line was pretty big which sucks but you know it's good! Their carnitas was cooked perfectly juicy and tender.
author: Timothy C.

description: Delicioso! I had the street bowl which is like a taco salad and it was my fave meal in San Fran! Only $8.50 too! San Fran is known for being foodie but it's been too foodie lately they are getting to extreme. Being from San Diego it's hard to eat Mexican but this place won't disappoint! Bf had tacos but he liked mine better. Burritos look good too!
author: Veronica W.

description: Speedy service. Very nice, appreciative of our business. Yummy tacos and salsa! Mexican Coke is the perfect accompanying beverage!
author: Always on the look-out R.

description: Great salsa. The chips were super fresh. The side of nopales was huge. The tacos were very generous.
author: john d.

description: Went here because of the ratings honestly wish I went to my regular spot at the marina "toma" way more authentic. Ordered a super burrito with carnitas. Burrito had guac sour cream carnitas lettuce rice black beans. With all those ingredients you'd think it would harmess flavor....no. burrito had no flavor was mushy like the stuff has been sitting couldn't even finish it halfway. Dissapointed...maybe I came there at a rare bad moment? Idk dont think I will give it another try.
author: Bryan P.

description: Food was awesome! But!!!!!.......the manager/owner is a creep he just stands out of the kitchen and micro manages everything including customers lol you can't just get what you want without him in your business...just sit back and watch this dude watch everyone and everything else... WEIRD! It's so Obvious!
author: Renato L.

description: Pleasantly surprised with this place! Delicious Mexican food!! Great prices and items. As well as a great atmosphere. I got the carne asada super burrito
author: Jasmin R.

description:
I could eat a good burrito every day for lunch and probably wouldn't get tired of it.  (Some weeks I probably do... Taqueria Cancun, El Burrito Express, Pancho Villa)   I've been to Street Taco a handful of times and have had various burritos with different meat options.

They don't make my favorite burrito in town but it's hard to complain about anything food-wise.  It's definitely a couple steps up from Zona Rosa, which is down the street, which I don't think is terrible but isn't anything better than average at best.  I think a lot of the mediocre places have decent options depending on what your preferences are.

My biggest complaint with Street Taco is the layout of the place.  The layout is a bit goofy.   The soda cooler makes it a little crowded and awkward to stand in line. Everyone seems to be in each other's way.

The prices aren't cheap either but I realize that the landlord probably creates a pretty good overhead on the place.
author: Chris S.

description: Good food but mediocre service. Maybe it's the constant attempts from the homeless youth trying to use the restroom and beg for food that makes the staff act indifferent towards every customer, but don't expect people to tip unless they enjoy being talked down to by a snobbish waiter who hates their job.
author: Rio B.

description: $7 gets you 2 huge street tacos. There is enough meat here for 4 tacos. Quality of meat is very good and the salsa very tasty and somewhat spicy.
author: Zee R.

description: Good carne asada burrito. Will definitely come back. My new favorite burrito place in SF.
author: Ruth C.

description: The price is good for what you get. I got the tacos and a side of rice- I really was filled up with just the tacos. The tacos are the real deal. It's like getting delicious tacos from a food truck or some janky looking place but the experience of being somewhere pretty nice. It's very clean and tidy there which is always something I appreciate. Will most likely come back again.
author: Kim V.

description: I got a super veggie burrito from Street Taco on a whim while I was enjoying a punch bowl next door with some friends. Let's just say I find myself thinking about the experience often. I might even say it was the best burrito I've had in SF...? By "super vegetarian burrito" I don't mean they just left the meat out. It had hot grilled veggies, rice, beans, guacamole, the works. I need to go back SOON.
author: Joe C.

description: Very delicious! The carnitas were SO JUICY. Huge portions of meat oozing out of the taco, you will need a fork (provided in the side). You can add sauce yourself on the side, green is pretty mild. Al pastor also tasty. Fish tacos good but not fried. I definitely recommend the carnitas most of all. These tacos are from Mexico City. I can tell! Nice and fast service.
author: Gloria C.

description: I just ordered a bean rice and cheese burrito here and I'm a vegetarian. The lady that was making it called my number and then said it was an Al Pastor burrito. The cashier said oh it's supposed to be a bean rice and cheese and of course the lady making it stupidly lied/changed her mind and said oh yeah I made the bean rice cheese. I guess I'm the idiot because I trusted her. I didn't realize it was an al Pastor until biting into it. I will never go here again because of their shady practices.
author: Chital S.

description: Delicious guacamole, friendly service, fresh ingredients, Street Taco was totally tasty. The prices were a little high considering the casual ambience and simple nature of the food, but well worth it.
author: Mo M.

description: I usually go to the mission for my tacos but this was a pretty good find in the Haight. There's not much seating but the line moves quickly and only a short wait for my food. Their spicy salsa is also good!
author: Kristin W.

description: The best Mexican fast food restaurant in the area. The meat is always grilled to order, which makes a huge difference.
author: Tomi M.

description: Came for the tacos after reading some great Yelp reviews, but in the end this place isn't worth leaving my neighborhood for. Salsa was just so-so and the tacos were definitely edible but not impressive. Would eat here again if I was hungry and in the neighborhood.
author: P P.

description:
Simple fresh great quality.
The quesadilla was spectacular the tacos very good.
This is not the most fancy restaurant around but a great example of what street food should be
author: Thomqs G.

description: Second time tying this place out and have not been disappointed. Today had the Carnitas super burrito and it was very good.  It would be nice if they had more choices in hot sauces, because I did not find the home made stuff to have much flavor or spice.
author: Frank C.

description: Good choices. Excellent flavor on the sauces & meats. It was quite crowded during lunch, tables packed, and not enough chairs. Liked that everyone can see the kitchen and the meals being prepared.
author: Abby M.

description: We wanted a quick lunch so we stopped in here. Really delicious fresh made tacos! I had the fish and carnitas - both amazing but the carnitas was my favorite. The fish comes with a large portion of fresh cooked fish! Really yummy - would definitely eat here again!
author: Kate B.

description: Pretty damn good and super fast service. Better and authentic than chipotle. Loud Mexican music , good vibe
author: B M.

description: Al Pastor is a little bite of heaven.  You cannot go wrong with anything you choose from here.  My go to's are the super burrito or taco bowl with the spicy salsa.  Good price for great food!
author: Jessica S.

description: We eat here at least 3 times a week. It's incredible how everything can be so good in just one tiny restaurant. Great guac, amazing salsas, perfectly seasoned carne asada. My life has improved since they opened across the street. Thank you Street Taco, you make me a better person.
author: Amanda P.

description: I went in on a Monday at 11:30 and only 1 other person was there. The place is clean and looks very basic. I ordered the veggie burrito and it was outstanding. The tortilla melted in my mouth. It was paper thin, so it wasn't the part that filled me up. Their seasoning is very tasty. Equal to  La Tacqueria, Farolito and food trucks like Señor Sisig. The only thing I didn't like is the price. I paid $9.74. I can get just as tasty burrito at the other named places, but for much cheaper. However, if you're in the area and you know you're going to have to spend that much anyway and in the mood for Mexican, this is your place!
author: Butch B.

description: A delicious street mexican place! I always go when I am visiting San Francisco!
author: Damon P.

description: Awesome Burritos! They are about $8.75 for the super burrito (cheese lettuce sour cream meat guac rice and beans). Well worth it. I am a big chipotle fan and this was a step up. Their tortilla was much softer and tastier. Highly recommended
author: Tobin O.

description: We found this place as we were strolling around. Most amazing Mexican we've had! Authentic and bursting with flavour :)
author: Crystal M.

description: Food is good. Owner is very rude. He screws up the order (three separate items) and then argues when I kindly mention it. Then he proceeded to shake his head and scoff me for paying with a debit card and not cash....to pay for the food....which is his business. The experience was off-putting and made my party uncomfortable. Chips, Guac and shrimp burrito were quite good, but the very rude owner ruined our dining experience and chances of going back.
author: Joey B.

description: Seriously the best carnitas I've ever had. May have to travel back to San Fran just to eat here again! My friend got the two tacos which she said were insanely good! Don't hesitate to eat here and get some to go for later!!!
author: Natalie M.

description: The nachos were the shiznit. The tacos were very tasty as well. Nice spot.  Reasonably priced.
author: Samuel D.

description: Yummy and affordable! Definitely a gem in the Haight! Love the food:-) and the staff are really friendly.
author: Gary Oliver L.

description: This was one of the only three places that we ate in San Francisco and I must say that it is amazing the portions were huge the food was totally authentic and delicious and everything there was made to order the horchata  that we had was totally delicious and I would def recommend this place for anyone
author: Derek F.

description: Amazing! Get the alambres super burrito with chicken. Green salsa is delicious. Staff are friendly. Street Taco is an all around great establishment in the Upper Haight.
author: John H.

description: I had the chorizo and carnitas tacos - definite 4.5*. Wife had a burrito and said it was a 3.5*.
author: Nathan M.

description: Al Pastor is a relative of Gyros and Shawarma. Marinated pork layered, spinning on a spit, with a slice of pineapple. roasting. And this is by far the best version in the Bay Area, and the only place I know of in the City that cooks it on a rotisserie, the proper way. Do not get anything else. Just Al Pastor tacos. If you are hungry, get three. They are huge though, so do not over order until you see how big they are. Other tacos are decent as well, if you insist. Fish, Carnitas, etc. They serve beer, Jarritos, and have a good salsa bar with all the condiments.
author: Kevin S.

description: Got the marinated pork super burrito. I don't normally eat mexican food but it was amazing. The staff were friendly and the place was clean. If mexican food tasted like this at home I'd eat it all the time! Defs drop in and grab something if you're in the area. It's located in a sweet spot with lots to look at near by and cute shops.
author: Victoria B.

description: Yum yum so happy about the amazing tacos definitely a lot of steak they don't skimp on anything worth the price and was able to order it at the bar next door and have drinks came quickly even know they were busy.
author: Melissa D.

description: I can't believe it took us so long to come here. The death of  Balazo  left  a  gaping taqueria  void on this side of town and so it was with trepidation that I let my husband talk me into going here last Thursday night.  Now I'm thinking that even if Balazo were still around, this place would be a serious contender.  We had tacos -- the one that was a combination of chorizo and beef, and the grilled chicken.  Both great, made better by the high quality tortilla, and only seven bucks for two.  The people there were also super friendly and nice.
author: Renee C.

description: Forget the tourist traps on Haight Street and grab a cactus taco bowl at Street Taco. You won't regret it!
author: Jay C.

description:
Oh my god this place is good. Carne Asado super burrito, spicy with black beans and the green salsa from the salsa bar every few bites. Delicious!

**oh, and I have no patience for people who think $7 for 2 enormous, high quality tacos from an actual restaurant and not a truck in an busy area is 'expensive'. Stay home and leave these hard working restaurant owners alone with your ridiculous expectations.
author: Lisa L.

description: Delish!   Loved the shrimp taco! The fish taco was basically a fish on a tortilla which was cool though I thought the shrimp taco had more flavor. We also tried to salad with chicken which was excellent. They make their own tortillas - also excellent. Limited seating is the only downfall. Yum!
author: Al W.

description: YUM. I'm from San Diego and like to think that I have pretty high standards for taco shops. I always get the Alambres(sp?) super burrito with chicken, black beans and hot salsa. Super happy with it. Everything is cooked perfectly, the flavor is outstanding, and the burrito is delightfully juicy. Also they're huge and I always save one half for my next meal. The hot salsa isn't very spicy, in my opinion, which works well for me because I'm actually a wimp when it comes to the truly hot hot sauce. If you're craving Mexican food in the Haight-Ashbury or Cole Valley districts, this is definitely your best bet.
author: Phylicia G.

description: Definitely the best taco place in San Francisco. I'm really excited to see a new location south of market. All tortillas are made to ordered and the salsa is great. I ordered the chips and salsa with two tacos and that is too much for one person. I was advised to try the lingua tacos but that's not my thing. She said it was the best lingua she's ever had. The chicken is air chilled and all ingredients are incredibly fresh.
author: Its M.

description: I couldn't pass up this place when I saw the green VW Beetle taxi on the sign. I had the tacos al pastor, which are good and big, but not great. The tortillas are nice and thick. Salsas are pretty good, too. Nice, friendly service. I'd go back.
author: JP C.

description: I really loved this place until I got their nachos today. Never in my life have I ever bit into a tortilla chip that was so stale that it took me 2 minutes to chew threw one chip. I can understand soggy chips. But chips so stale the don't even Crack when you try to break them. They just folded over on themselves. It's gross. Plus my food was cold. I'm very very dissapointed. If I could give less then one star I would. Yall were amazing when you first opened. Now your just lazy cheap asses. Throw the uneaten chips away at the end of the day. Don't try to use the same batch of chips 2 days in a row.
author: Marissa H.

description: So delish! I discovered it yesterday and came back today. The street bowl is made with a tasty flaky tostada... Get it! The best meat is al pastor (marinated pork). Yum!
author: Kimmy P.

description: We were recommended to this restaurant by a friend. We tried to find a good tacos restaurants in SF and we finally give it a try. To our surprise, their food is very good. I love their spicy salsa and beef tacos. This restaurant becomes my favorite place to eat. The down side is you can't get the table to sit in because there are only a handful table.
author: Michelle L.

description: Authentic Mexican tacos. Tried chorizo and pastor, really good.
author: Tina D.

description: This is without a doubt my favorite Mexican place in the world. I would eat three meals a day here no problem (my boyfriend basically already does). All the food is AMAZING, although my favorites have been the carne asada quesadilla, the carne asada super burrito, and the Street Caesar with carne asada. The servers are fast,courteous and amazing chefs. I have never had a disappointing meal or experience at Street Taco and will continue to be a frequent customer every week. I wish they catered so I could hire them for work functions!
author: Hillary C.

description: It was amazingly crowded, which is completely understood once you have their food!  The campechano taco (chorizo and beef) was one of the better tacos I've had.  Their al pastor was excellent too.  One review in Yelp described "crispy" carnitas, but it really wasn't crispy.  It was OK, though, but not nearly as good as the others..... If you're in the Haight and can deal with a long line to order, you can't go wrong!
author: Larry D.

description: Great tasting carne asada filled tacos. love that they have fresh agua frescas! a little bummed you have to buy tacos in twos but it's good stuff. New and clean restaurant in Haight.
author: Amy T.

description: I'm upgrading this place to 4-stars after my second visit. The first time I had fish and shrimp tacos and was very underwhelmed. This time I ordered a burrito, and that is definitely the way to go! I don't eat much meat (I'll occasionally eat chicken) and prefer a vegetarian burrito. They don't even list this on the menu but all you have to do is ask. I got a "no-meat" burrito with black beans and guacamole and it was actually pretty darn good. Still doesn't quite measure up to a Mission style taqueria, but for the Haight, this beats out Zona Rosa and El Faro by a long shot. Their salsa bar is also pretty good - 3 different kinds including a tomatillo which is always my favorite.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Even tho it says street tacos, it's the furthest thing from street. That being said...get the fish tacos.
author: Xavier T.

description: This place is the JUMP OFF ! Came here last week (they opened 2 weeks ago) & let me tell you,  his place is ON , some of the best i have had in the Haight. They really are tajing iut the mexican food spots in the Haight ( Zona Rosa & El Farol) Highly reccomend this spot .
author: Mario S.

description: Had the chicken quesadilla with a watermelon drink and my sister ordered a burrito with a horchata. Total cost was about $25 for the both of us, which I thought was reasonably price due to the huge portion size. The meat in both the quesadilla and burrito were nice and juicy. The green salsa was the spiciest, but also one of the better sauces and the drinks were very refreshing. The facility was clean and the workers were very friendly.
author: Susan Y.

description: The best tacos for the $$ and they cook them hot on the grill right in front of you. Two tacos for $7 and they are yummy!
author: Brandon C.

description: Love this place. Definitely taken over as the best Mexican in the haight and inner sunset. The burritos are crazy good but the tacos ate actually better.  Eat the carnitas and the chicken or steak with peppers at the bottom of the menu. Really nice counter people and high quality ingredients. You can't go wrong here.  Eat the food!
author: Benjamin R.

description: Awesome tacos at a really reasonable price. Friendly atomosphere and great service. the space is a little tight but people seem to eat and go. The guac was good and the portions for everything were appropriate. The mexican.sodas are nice to try as well. A must try if youre in the area.
author: Marc L.

description: Pretty good restaurant with delicious salsa de guacamole. So Good! Tacos are good. Really nice employees too!
author: Oskar D.

description: This place is delicious. I had the Carne asada tacos for $7 (for 2) and they were really good with a lot of meat on them. My friend ordered al pastor nachos and also good. Highly recommend
author: Freddy F.

description: Their Pastor tacos are the best I've ever had. It's s shame I live outside the city because I would be here all the time. Next time and every time I come to SF I'm coming back. BEST TACOS EVER.
author: Trina N.

description: Finally. Good Mexican food in the Upper Haight. Sorry, Zona Rosa and El Faro (Formerly El Balazo. Still terrible though.) Your shit's weak. I was getting tired of walking to Little Chihuahua for some white ass Mexican food.
author: Jules P.

description: 'Street taco' was a bit misleading... This place is fantastic. The quesadilla was totally loaded... And the bowl was gigantic. Awesome value.
author: Mitch B.

description: This place has great tacos with lots of options to choose from. Wish it were in south Florida.
author: Jeff N.

description: Nice quick taco option.  Not cheap but good.  I've tried the tacos, burritos and street bowl.  The only thing that I would not recommend is the street bowl, although my issue with it was something that could easily be fixed.  The person that made my bowl did not bother to drain the liquid from the beans, at least that's where I'm assuming all the liquid came from, because my tortilla bowl was soggy, which was disappointing.  Although the chicken and carne asada are both good, my favorite is the carnitas.  It was tasty and moist, where carnitas are quite dry at other places.  Overall a good quick option, if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Heather G.

description: Seriously awesome Mexican food. I was walking down Haight Street to kill some time and I noticed that this place was poppin' for some time. I ordered carnitas tacos and they were bomb, even though I did let them sit for a while. A lot of people seemed to order their Mexican soda but I just got water. Service is quick even though there were so many people.
author: Lola H.

description:
tl;dr: Try it. Seriously.

The place and ambiance: Went there on a quiet sunday night. The place was well lit. There's a counter adorned with cheerful colors, some pretty newspapery letters and cliché - but none the less particularly appropriate - SF phrases. On top of this little waist high fort, there's a plastic pane that let's the cooks' cheerful but quiet interaction shine through. One of the cooks and the guy on the register were having same the kind of conversation I would have with a friend of mine and wouldn't be able to post here. One slight smile of mine suspends into their conversation, blatantly pointing out they have been understood unwillingly. The cashier draws an awkward smile, and beckons my order with a nod. "Street bowl with chicken allambra". "Spicy?" While I wobble my indecisive gnarl, he friendly encourages me to make it so. I feared a bit that the spiciness would show me what's proper mexican, and to keep out of other people's conversation. I mindlessly pay and turn around to find seating. There's a lot of open tables, clearly resting from earlier bustlier hours. I pick the closest one and proceed to appreciate even more appropriate but cliché decorations. 10 languid minutes go by as I, yet again, get lost in their entertained conversations.

The food: The bowl is edible! :D Light and fluffy fried dough, reminiscent of filo. Very well composed and plentiful filling. Very much on the same league as El Farolito (the sober one, at least). I wished I had been man enough to go for a burrito.

After match: I did not poop fire. I think I'm yet to learn my lessons. Will listen to more conversations. Will definitely go back.
author: Paulo K.

description: The food is great at this location, about 15 -20 min away from pier 39. Worth the drive.
author: Alex G.

description: One of my favorite Mexican food joints in the city. Friendly staff, nice atmosphere if you choose to eat there, and most importantly excellent Mexican food. Try the carnitas and/or el pastor.
author: Cameron J.

description: Loved this place for a quick lunch! The food is super fresh and tasty. They were pretty busy but got people served quickly. Seriously, the al pastor pork was delicious. Great little find while spending an afternoon exploring Haight Street.
author: Amy R.

description: Definitely a great Mexican place. Everything was perfect.  The pastor is to die for! It's a little more expensive than a typical taqueria but you definitely get what you pay for. Salsa was perfect, friendly staff, great environment.  Hope to come here again soon!
author: Nate B.

description: Came here and had a chorizo burrito. It's was good can't complain about it. I would come back and eat here again but I've had better but for the Haight it's a great taco joint that has some good eats. With it being close to the bar we always go to it makes it so convenient to eat at. Place is always busy so that's a good sign.
author: Krishna V.

description: These tacos are to die for. The al pastor is amazing and the carne asada is perfect. I haven't had a taco this good in a very long time. Will for SURE be back. I'm already addicted.
author: Alana R.

description: I've been debating the 3 vs 4 here, I really think if I could give it 3.5 stars I would. Street taco makes decent tacos for a decent price. Definitely a place you can depend on. I think the chips are a little weak whether you dine in or out and the salsas were not the best I've had. I did like my carne asada tacos and the guy at the register is always fun to chat with. A good staple on Haight. I'll be back when I need a taco fix.
author: Lauren P.

description: Some of the best Mexican food i've had in a while. Really really good service too. Nice, friendly guys, and delicious tacos. Very cheap as well.
author: Caleb W.

description:
I'm really rooting for this place and I think it has the potential to be my go-to spot (ahead of Little Chihuahua). A few easy things that could make the place better.

-Reusable salsa containers and water cups
-A few more options for the salsas
-Labels for the salsas so we know what we're getting (hot, medium, mild)
-Hot sauces available for additional punch
-Beer on draft and glass pint glasses (although the BYO aspect is nice if you remember before going)
-Chips given right after placing the order
-Delivery of orders to tables (instead of yelling out the order number)

Thanks guys, looking forward to seeing some nice improvements as you settling into the neighborhood!
author: Daniel F.

description: So good. Everything looks quality fresh made form good ingredients. Guaranteed one will leave with a full belly. There is no medium just mild or spicey flavor options. I had a the super burrito - it was flavorful and delicious. They have Mexican coca cola in glass bottles. Fast service. My friend had the shrimp tacos - and she liked it too. The shrimps were a nice size as well.
author: Zita M.

description: Thee best Mexican food I have ever eaten.  I had the toco bowl with the marinated pork, my GF and son had steak quesadilla and both dishes were out of this world!
author: Joshua M.

description: This place trumps all the others in the area. I have to talk myself out of going here everyday for dinner. The Carnitas is out of this world. I have not been disappointed with anything I've ordered.  But the Carnitas... I'm addicted.
author: Mike R.

description:
Terrific customer service. 
Awesome fresh tortillas. 
Huge portions of meat on the tacos yet the masterpieces don't fall apart. Not sure how this is even possible -- so good!
Great salsas. 
El pastor may be the best but chicken and carne asada were killer too. 
Can't wait to go back!
author: dr r.

description: Good price, ingredients were all super fresh and burrito was delicious. All the meat is cooked to order which is a huge plus.
author: CJ A.

description: Finally!! delicious Mexican food in the Haight. I ordered the burrito which is served on a homemade tortilla.   It was terrific. Chips and salsa were excellent too. I recommend this modern taqueria without reservation.
author: Bob W.

description: Delicious! I just went there & had fish tacos which were very good. $9 for two but they are very large & filling. I live in Haight & have walked by waiting to  open. So many burrito places in neighborhood but not one decent taco place. Very nice guy behind counter who I think is owner. Nice ambiance & good re-do of old askew restaurant. Simple menu but very nice- go!
author: Jody L.

description: Al pastor was really delicious. Carne asada good, not phenomenal. Horchata was also very good.
author: Amy C.

description: I highly recommend getting a loaded quesadilla. The Al Pastor is incredible and the service is great too. I hope this place stays around for a while!
author: Jon B.

description: Hands down, best corn tortillas in SF.  If you have a spot that you think is better, please let me know.
author: Scott L.

description: This place is AMAZING!! Al pastor fresh everyday. Carnitas is amazing. All around best Mexican food you can get in this area.
author: Max D.

description: Friendly service and quality pork and seafood tacos. Meat was flavorful and portions were generous. Minus 1 star for lack of a decent salsa bar, specifically no serranos or jalapenos (fresh or even pickled) to make tacos spicy. All in all a positive addition to Haight Street!
author: Karina L.

description: This place came into town and showed all the old "classic" taquerias what the eff is up. Their super burritos are as good as the city has to offer.
author: Uli Z.

description: This is now my favorite place to a get a burrito in SF. It actually doesn't taste or look very "street". Though I usually like my burritos "wild" with every sort of shenanigans in it, this place had more of a fresh, simple taste. I had the grilled fish burritos which probably violated a Mayan law but it tasted good. Real Mexicans don't eat burritos anyways. Their tacos are tasty too but not quite filling enough for me. I'm in the major league of heavy eating.
author: Charles Z.

description: This place is awesome.  I had the chorizo and beef burrito and it was delicious.  Not a ton of seating, however that is the only drawback I see.
author: Tom H.

description: Gotta Taco' about it! We're eaten here twice in the last two weeks. A great find if you want delicious tacos, or nachos. Al Pastor is really something. The burritos are also good, but they could distribute all the flavors in the burrito more, rather than have everything segregated.
author: Owen M.

description: I was really excited as I walked by this place every day as they were preparing it for their grand opening. This place was called Street Taco but right below their name they advertised Mexico city street food-I assumed they were going to have a variety of street food. I thought finally I would be able to get awesome Mexican food that wasn't a burrito or a taco. On my first visit I was immediately disappointed as I looked at the menu and saw their offerings were tacos, burritos, nachos and quesadillas- things I could get right across the street and down the street at any of the other taquerias in this neighborhood. I had two al pastor tacos and they were good, but I couldn't get over my disappointment. I thought I would see sopes, gorditas, something different but I guess it's just another taqueria.
author: Maggie T.

description: So I had ordered a super burrito with refried beans and chicken. Got home and opened it up anf saw that I received a burrito with no chicken or meat whatsoever along with black beans. I'm assuming that the burrito I received was meant for a vegetarian most likely or someone who didn't want meat. Ended up eating half of it and throwing it away because I was just salty about receiving the wrong order
author: Danny W.

description:
If you are kosher or have allergies or don't eat red meat, BEWARE - there is bacon in the chicken alambres. The menu says "chicken or beef w/ peppers and cheese." So, I was very surprised to find large pieces of bacon in my tacos. I thought it might be a mistake so I asked the cashier, and he told me that alambres always has bacon in it. I pointed out that the menu doesn't say anything about bacon, and he shrugged. Well Señor, this is not Mexico City and you can't just assume everyone knows what alambres is. 
Service aside, the food was tasty and I will probably give it another try since I live in the neighborhood.
author: Laura B.

description: Handmade tortillas, signature sauces, Victor cares about food and is proud of his heritage. Great tacos, nice place, I'm going back.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
The burritos and tacos are great!
However, I ordered the chips and salsa, and for $4.25 I expected more than a handful of chips and salsa, the salsa is otherwise free with my burrito. 
I, in essence, paid $4.25 for a handful of chips, which at any other Mexican restaurant are free. Chips and salsa shouldn't be on the menu. Get the guacamole.
Otherwise I would have given them 5 stars.
author: July C.

description: This place has the best tacos ever! I crave this place if I don't have it after awhile. The service is pretty fast! And it's in a neat location. I recommend this place to anyone that is in the area and would like to try some Mexican food.
author: Ashley K.

description: Grabbed lunch here and it was great. Got the marinated pork and all was well. Enjoyed the burrito coma afterwards.
author: Josh S.

description: I ate here for the first time last week and was pretty impressed with the quality of stake tacos and the fair pricing. I'll be coming back.
author: Marina R.

description: tacos are gigantic with fatty, tasty cuts of meat. probably the best mexican food in the haight area.
author: Sherman L.

description: This place opened 10 days ago and is a much needed addition to the Upper Haight.  The food is fantastic, highlighted by house-made tortillas and grilled to order meats.  The carnitas are delicious as is the marinated pork.  Juan Carlos and his brother have really hit the sweet spot with their new restaurant.  The food is well priced and VERY good.  This is my new go to Mexican place West of Divis.
author: Jed W.

description: Delicious burritos for being nowhere near the mission. A+ in my book for a good blend of ingredients and consistency. Definitely go for the super.
author: Dave H.

description: So Good!! One order of tacos enough to get full.. a lot of meat on tacos. Restaurant's small.. so it gets full. I didn't mind standing for 10 minutes to devour my food
author: Jesus D.

description:
I have been searching for the PERFECT taco de carnitas in San Francisco. I FOUND IT HERE!!! I also tried their carne asada, which is really really good. But their carnitas are out of this world, even better than Nopalito. Rich and delicious and they melt in your mouth. Their tortillas are deliciously hand-made, and the salsa verde... mhhhh. At first I thought it was a bit expensive, but when I tasted the quality (and quantity) of the food, it just made sense. It is totally worth it. 

This place is super new and you can tell: everything is so clean, including every little corner of the bathroom.  I hope they keep up the cleanliness and the good quality of the food.
author: Lalu Ciya P.

description: I had the nachos and the street salad. I can recommend both. The service is quick and the food fresh.The one detraction is that the dining area is not as clean as it could be.
author: W W.

description: Carnitas and chicken tacos were passable but fish in fish tacos tasted like it was a few days old. Spat it out after taking a bite.
author: Lucifer N.

description: Small, service is quick and friendly, a little pricey for the food though. I had the Carnitas tacos which has some of the tenderest pork I've ever had. Very good.
author: Mike Z.

description: Excellent place to stop in for lunch or dinner prices are great , we throughly enjoyed our meals and would definitely return .. Thanks to the staff at Street Taco :)
author: Brent H.

description: Stopped in yesterday for a quick bite. Plenty of food and reasonable prices. I had tacos and my wife had the bowl. We both had al pastor (pork) and were really satisfied. We're visiting from NY so,we won't have a chance to go back this trip, but we WILL be back!
author: Fred T.

description: Extremely friendly, DELICIOUS food and very reasonably priced!! This is my new go to for burritos!!
author: Natasha C.

description: Totally love this place! The food is amazing! I'm mexican and just move to sf 7 months ago! I finally found a great spot for authentic street food! LOVE IT!
author: Nayeli D.

description: Great value, fast (when the customers aren't making a scene), and really really delicious.
author: Alexander H.

description: Uh oh... This place might give my other love, Zona Rosa a run for their money. Got both the super carnita and pollo burrito. Both really good and juicy. Now I've lived around here most of my life. I've seen so many food establishments come and go were the street taco is now located. Don't bag on how small the place is. It's not what makes the food pretty good, it's the people behind the counter making it. They where all super nice to me and  put up with the mess I made at the salsa bar. I hope they keep up the positive vibe during their hopefully long run on Haight. Don't get me wrong. I still love my Zona Rosa....only this place is much closer to my location and got my attention. Welcome to the Haight Street Taco, you'll be in my belly!
author: Joshua B.

description: The Tacos al Pastor are amazing. This is the only place that I know in the Bay Area where they make the al Pastor tacos the traditional way by roasting the meat instead of just frying it. I tried the al Pastor and the Ribs tacos and they both were delicious. My new favorite taqueria in the Bay Area by far!
author: Hugo G.

description: The nachos I had here yesterday were so good I'm still thinking about them today. Will be back to try the fish / shrimp tacos / burritos.
author: Josh W.

description: What a nice addition to the neighborhood!  Finally a very good Mexican restaurant on Haight.  It's simple, tasty, quick, full of flavors, what else to ask?
author: Laurent G.

description: Live up the street and had a great first experience at Street Taco. Friendly staff and great food. Only downfall is there may not be enough seating on busy days. Looking forward to retraining!
author: Jen S.

description: Great little place. We got fish tacos and shrimp tacos. Really good. Little expensive but worth it. Lots of options for self serve salsas. And that guac was bomb
author: Maiera M.

description: I live in the area & actually come to Street Taco almost everyday. Those that reside in the area understand how touristy & congested the area can be. To get around that, I order take out for pick up 20min early & bring someone along so I can hop out the car while we are double parked outside since it's almost impossible to find parking on Haight Street. Today, I did the normal routine but the line was almost out the door, I see my burrito sitting there & went straight to the register, but the lady said "back of the line for pick up"... After 15min in line plus ordered 20min ago... I'm starving & cranky, and thought I can end this with a nice shrimp burrito, but guess what, ITS COLD... And the shrimp... SUPER COLD! Before I left, I asked "does my food sit on a warmer?" & she said yes! Now to top things off, I'm more disappoint that I've been lied to. I'm driving to the East Bay now, so can't turn back now. Too bad, the food is actually good but I give 2 stars for customer service. If they get another register or you can pay over the phone for take out, I'll think about coming back then...
author: Lora B.

description: I had the carnitas burrito. TERRIBLE. meat tough and overcooked. got sick. they cook raw flank stake alongside warming up already cooked meat on the same grill. Was grossed out by that. Instead of cooking large amounts of meat and then place into the food warmer trays, they make everything to order, but the food they warm up is already cooked. So not only do you have to wait a long time for your number to come up, it takes longer to get your order. Would never go back to this establishment.
author: Kay C.
